englishContents: The course mixes lectures on methodology with exercises and applications of the models to data on behaviour in various contexts. The methodological part introduces the microeconomic framework based on random utility maximization that is fundamental for discrete choice models. Furthermore, it focuses on the most common discrete choice models: multinomial logit models and nested logit model. In addition, we also look at more advanced models and how they can enhance the realism of the modelling. The applications focus on how to apply the models to real as well as hypothetical data. The final part of the course focuses on overall and critical understanding of the methodology through application of the methods in a project.
danishContents: Kurset består af forelæsninger om metode blandet med øvelser og modelanvendelser på adfærdsdata fra forskellige domæner. Den metodiske del introducere det mikroøkonomiske grundlag baseret på stokastisk nyttemaksimering, som danner grundlag for diskrete valgmodeller. Derudover introduceres de mest normale modeller: multinomiel logit og nested logit, samt mere avancerede modeller som er mere realistiske. Anvendelserne fokuserer på hvordan modellerne kan benyttes på både observationsdata og hypotetiske data. Kurset afsluttes med et større projekt, som lægger vægt på at den studerende opnår en selvstændig og kritisk forståelse af metoden.

englishContents: Behavioral research in road safety, from data collection via survey to data analysis via qualitative and quantitative methods. Modelling accident frequency and severity by the use of statistical and econemitric methods. Project work based on existing and collected data on a road safety topic chosen by the students under the supervision of the course responsible.
danishContents: Adfærdsforskning indenfor trafiksikkerhed, fra dataindsamling over spørgeskemaundersøgelser til dataanalyse ved hjælp af kvalitative og kvantitative metoder. Modellering af uheldshyppighed og skadesgrad ved benytelse af statistiske og økonomiske metoder. Projektarbejde på grundlag af eksisterende og indsamlede data om et trafiksikkerhedsrelateret emne efter de studerendes eget valg, under den kursusansvarliges tilsyn.

englishContents: The content will be in two stages (approx. 1 week each): concepts and methodologies, provided by instructor and DTU faculty; tools and challenges, provided by invited lecturers from private and public sector. The goal is to design feasible solutions for real-world challenges, using the concepts learned. Stage 1: The concept of the “Smart City” and the interactions between transport and other systems (e.g. energy, environment) through new technologies. Introduction to systems approach, where the inputs, outputs and the ”boundaries” of a system are clearly delineated, with specific focus on decision variables (that effect the system) and system evaluation. Enhancement of transportation through new technologies including data sciences tools (from data preparation to regression/classification/clustering, to visualisation), autonomous vehicles, Vehicle to Vehicle (V2V) communication, smartphone apps, and new sensors. Stage 2: The role of new and mature tools (e.g. software, sensors, new devices) in the future of mobility. Current grand challenges for mobility in our cities, how to approach them, assess the potentials of solutions and design their implementation.
danishTitle: Projekter inden for mobilitet i en "Smart City"-kontekst
danishContents: Indholdet af kurset vil blive inddelt i to faser (af ca. 1 uges varighed hver), der vil omhandle koncepter og metodologi formidlet af en vejleder og DTU Faculty, samt værktøjer og udfordringer, formidlet af inviterede foredragsholdere fra den private og offentlige sektor. Målet er at kunne designe mulige løsninger til "den virkelige verden" ved at benytte de tillærte koncepter.Fase 1: Begrebet "Smart City" og samspillet mellem transport og andre systemer (f.eks. energi, miljø) gennem ny teknologi. Introduktion til tilgang af systemet hvor input, output og system-grænser er klart afbildede med et specifikt fokus på beslutningsvariabler (som påvirker systemet) og systemevaluering. Forbedring af transport gennem ny teknologi, herunder datavidenskabelige værktøjer (fra data forberedelse til regression/klassificering/samling til visualisering), autonome køretøjer, Vehicle to Vehicle (V2V) kommunikation, smartphone apps og nye sensorer.Fase 2: Betydningen af de nye og de gamle værktøjer (f.eks. software, sensorer, nye enheder) for fremtidens mobilitet. Nuværende store udfordringer for mobilitet i vores byer, hvordan griber man disse an, vurderer løsningspotentialerne samt designer implementeringen.
englishTitle: Projects for Mobility in the Smart City

englishContents: The classes are taught in an interactive manner, with theoretical parts, intermingled with practice with Jupyter Notebooks. Main topics are: Introduction to Python programming and Pandas, data visualisation, forecasting and regression models, classification, clustering, dimensionality reduction. The methods will be exemplified through different cases within e.g. transportation, business management and marketing.
danishContents: The classes are taught in an interactive manner, with theoretical parts, intermingled with practice with Jupyter Notebooks. Main topics are: Introduction to Python programming and Pandas, data visualisation, forecasting and regression models, classification, clustering, dimensionality reduction. The methods will be exemplified through different cases within e.g. transportation, business management and marketing.

englishContents: Part I: Functional aspects and characteristics of public transport (PT) services•	Types of PT, and their characteristics•	Intelligent Transport Systems (ITS) technologies used for PT•	Influence of future technologies to PT such as autonomous vehicles Part II: Public transport operations planning process•	Strategic planning•	Transit route and network design considering passengers' route choices•	Transit coordination, connectivity, and services synchronisationPart III: Public transport modelling•	Data representation and data collection•	Planning process, travel demand, passenger behaviour, mode and route choice, case studies•	Frequency-based/schedule-based assignment, deterministic/stochastic, static/dynamic, equilibrium/non-equilibrium
danishTitle: Planlægning og modellering af kollektiv trafik
danishContents: Del I: Funktionsaspekter og karakteristika af kollektiv transport/public transport (PT) services:•	Typer af PT og deres karakteristika•	Intelligente Transportsystemer (ITS) teknologier indenfor PT•	Effekt af fremtidige teknologier såsom selvkørende køretøjerDel II: Planlægningsproces for driften af den kollektive transport: •	Strategisk planlægning•	Design af kollektive transportnetværk og -ruter med fokus på passagerers' rutevalg•	PT koordinering, forbindelser og synkronisering af servicesDel III: Modellering af kollektiv transport•	Datafremstilling og dataindsamling•	Planlægningsproces, rejseefterspørgsel, passageradfærd, transportmiddelvalg og rutevalg, case studier.•	Frekvens- og køreplansbaseret rutevalgsmodel, deterministisk/stokastisk, statisk/dynamisk, ligevægtsmodeller
englishTitle: Planning and Modelling of Public Transport

englishContents: This course will have lectures with slides and with laboratory work using interactive tools (e.g. Jupyter notebook). Students will always work manually each module, during and after the theoretical class, to assimilate new concepts. It is designed to be incremental, and strongly supported with practice. Modules:  - Review of basics – random variable, probability distributions, Bayes Theorem - Probabilistic Graphical Models foundations – Bayesian networks, factorization,  D-separation, conditional independence- Probabilistic Graphical Models – Generative models, Representing your own problem  - Different models – Regression, Classification, Temporal models, Topic Models- Inference – Exact Inference - Inference – Markov Chain Monte Carlo - Inference – Variational Inference- Advanced topics
danishContents: Dette kursus består af forelæsninger understøttet af slides, samt laboratorie arbejde udført med interaktive værktøjer (såsom Jupyter notebook). Studerende på dette kursus vil altid arbejde manuelt i hvert modul, under og efter den teoretiske del, for at tilegne sig nye koncepter. Kurset er designet til at være trinvis og stærkt understøttet af praksis.Moduler:- Gennemgang af grundprincipperne-stokastisk variable, sandsynlighedsfordelinger, Bayes  Theorem- Probabilistiske grafiske modeller fundamenter - Bayesian netværk, faktorisering,   D-separation, betinget uafhængighed.- Probabilistiske grafiske modeller - generative modeller som repræsenterer dit problemfelt- Forskellige modeller - Regression, Klassifikation, Temporale modeller, Emnemodeller- Inferens - Eksakt Inteferens- Inferens - Markov Chain Monte Carlo- Inferens - Variationsregning Inferens- Avancerede emner

englishContents: The course will contain a significant element of statistics and simulation. In addition, an understanding of model systems, how they can be estimated and subsequently used as a basis for simulation and prediction. The course will apply 4-5 realistic cases to illustrate how different methods can be applied to different domains. The students are expected to acquire the theory, to understand how models are constructed and can be used in practice. The course will introduce R and Python software and provide notebooks for the different applications.
danishContents: Kurset vil indeholde et betydeligt element af statistik og simulation. Derudover også en forståelse af modelsystemer, hvordan de kan estimeres og efterfølgende anvendes som basis for simulation and prediction. Kurset vil anvende 4-5 realistiske cases til at illustrerer hvordan forskellige metoder kan anvendes på forskellige domæner. De studerende forventes at tilegne sig teorien, at forstå hvordan modeller er opbygget og kan anvendes i praksis. Kurset vil også introducerer Python and R software og dedikerede 'notebooks' for de forskellige anvendelser.

englishContents: The course consists of lectures and tutorials. In the tutorial sessions, students have the opportunity to consolidate the material from the lectures. The approach is problem-based. The lectures will introduce the examples and the required programming tools. The emphasis will be on empirical work and the tutorials will offer the student the possibility to work with these methods. After taking this course the student will be able to carry out a hedonic price analysis, assess the importance of heterogeneity in willingness to pay for local amenities and to set up and estimate a horizontal (logit-based) residential sorting model.
danishContents: Kurset indeholder forelæsninger og en række praktiske øvelser. Teorien anvendes og afprøves i praktiske øvelser. Fokus er på problembaseret læring. Kurset inkluderer også introduktion til de nødvendige programmeringsværktøjer. En studerende, der som har gennemført kurset, vil kunne gennemføre en hedonisk pris analyse, analysere heterogenitet af betalingsvillighederne for bykvaliteter og estimere og fortolke en horisontal-sorting model.

englishContents: General introduction to Facilities Management teory and practice, including usability of buildings during the whole life cycle, integration of operational aspects in the planning of new buildings as well as tasks and tools for management of a FM-organisation.
danishContents: Generel indføring i Facilities Management teori og praksis, herunder bygningers anvendelse gennem hele deres livscyklus, integration af driftsmæssige aspekter i planlægningen af nyt byggeri samt opgaver og værktøjer ved ledelses af en FM-organisation

englishContents: Complex numerical experiments using both regional and global climate models are important tools for understanding the climate system. Climate models are also essential for projecting and evaluating the impacts of climate change to human and natural systems and are in this context often used as part of detailed modeling chain involving, e.g., physical,  ecological and/or socio-economic models. Such results frequently serve as input to decision-making on, e.g., adaptation.This course provides a comprehensive introduction to the fundamentals of climate modeling and climate model analysis. The course is aimed at students from different backgrounds and master programmes, who will use climate model data to assess for example the potential climate change impacts on, e.g., energy and water systems, urban, terrestrial as well as marine environments, including as means to facilitate adaptation decision-making. The course introduces the general structure and functionality of state-of-the-art climate models as well as a number of key analyses techniques like the use of multi-model ensembles for climate change assessments. The course reviews observations of past (proxy) as well as recent and present day instrumental climate variations based on remote sensing techniques, ground observations, etc.  It is discussed how observations may be used to validate climate models and variations be attributed to different climate drivers using, e.g. 20th century "hindcasts"; and how future climate conditions are simulated by state-of-the-art climate models. Lastly, the course provides an extensive introduction and hands-on experience in using climate model data for different kinds of analyses.
danishContents: Complex numerical experiments using both regional and global climate models are important tools for understanding the climate system. Climate models are also essential for projecting and evaluating the impacts of climate change to human and natural systems and are in this context often used as part of detailed modeling chain involving, e.g., physical,  ecological and/or socio-economic models. Such results frequently serve as input to decision-making on, e.g., adaptation.This course provides a comprehensive introduction to the fundamentals of climate modeling and climate model analysis. The course is aimed at students from different backgrounds and master programmes, who will use climate model data to assess for example the potential climate change impacts on, e.g., energy and water systems, urban, terrestrial as well as marine environments, including as means to facilitate adaptation decision-making. The course introduces the general structure and functionality of state-of-the-art climate models as well as a number of key analyses techniques like the use of multi-model ensembles for climate change assessments. The course reviews observations of past (proxy) as well as recent and present day instrumental climate variations based on remote sensing techniques, ground observations, etc.  It is discussed how observations may be used to validate climate models and variations be attributed to different climate drivers using, e.g. 20th century "hindcasts"; and how future climate conditions are simulated by state-of-the-art climate models. Lastly, the course provides an extensive introduction and hands-on experience in using climate model data for different kinds of analyses.

englishContents: The theme is the interaction between city, citizens, infrastructure and transportation. The project work deals with specific localities in the Greater Copenhagen Region. Assessment of the possibilities of urban development within the specific localities, evaluation of the impact of transport and design of transport solutions are all part of the project. Most likely there will be conflicts related to the areas like urban densification exploiting local green areas.
danishContents: Det gennemgående tema er samspillet mellem by, beboere, infrastruktur og transport. I projektarbejdet tager man fat i konkrete områder i hovedstadsregionen. I projektarbejdet vurderes muligheder for en hensigtsmæssig byudvikling det givne sted, de trafikale konsekvenser lokalt og regionalt, design af byplan løsninger. Områderne vil typisk rumme en række konflikter, for eksempel inddragelse af grønne områder ved fortætning.

englishContents: The course is dedicated to building competences on development of tools for evaluating sustainable urban planning and evaluation of effective solutions for addressing the areas of urban development including energy,transportation, water, waste, climate mitigation and adaptation.The cities are today responsible for the largest part of the global pollution and in 2050 80% of the global population of 9 billion will live in cities. Professional engineers and planners therefore have to experience the challenge of solving the multidimensional challenge of managing competing demands from energy demand and production, transportation demand and infrastructure development and land use development. The assessment of numerous case examples and the presence of invited guest speakers will help illustrate the implications of different practices and policies in achieving sustainable urban development.
danishContents: Kurset fokuserer på væsentlige aspekter indenfor udvikling af værktøjer til evaluering af bæredygtig byplanlægning og evaluering af effektive løsninger inden for bæredygtig byudvikling  indenfor energi, transport, vand, affald, reduktion af klimapåvirkninger samt klimatilpasning. Byerne står i dag for den største del af den globale foruering i 2050 vil 80% af den samlede befolkning på ni milliarder bo i byerne. Ingeniører er derfor nødt til at lære at håndtere de mangeartede problemstillinger der er knyttet til det urbane miljø såsom: energibehov og energiproduktion, transportbehov og infrastrukturudvikling, arealbehov og arealanvendelseKurset vil blive understøttet af inviterede gæsteforelæsere og en række praktiske eksempler på bestræbelserne på at fremme bymæssige bæredygtighed.
englishTitle: Sustainable Development Indicators and Sustainable Urban Development

englishContents: The course simulates the responsibilities of a sustainability coordinator in a municipality or a planning consultant. Overall strategic objectives are translated into achievable projects that deliver the desired effect for the benefit of citizens, nature, environment and climate. The course is structured around a process of goal-setting, idea generation, prioritization, development, documentation, action, reflection and communication.
danishContents: Kurset simulerer det fremtidige job for en bæredygtigheds koordinator i en kommune eller en planlægningskonsulent. Overordnede strategiske målsætninger omsættes til realiserbare projekter, som leverer den ønskede effekt til gavn for borgere, natur, miljø og klima. Kurset er struktureret omkring en process med opstilling af mål, idegenerering, prioritering, udvikling, dokumentation, handlingsplaner, refleksion og kommunikation.
englishTitle: Sustainable Urban Development: a project oriented approach

englishContents: Society is facing increasing risks from climate change, in particular related to extreme events like intense rains, storm surges, storms, heat waves and drought. Planning of adaptation measures accordingly is a high priority of governments, businesses and property owners everywhere. The development of robust and cost effective adaptation strategies is a very complicated process involving integrated risk assessment of before mentioned climate events, their associated impacts such as flooding, estimation of damage costs, and assessment of adaptation measures, which requires a multidisciplinary approach as well as close interactions between professionals and decision-makers. Further, damage cost assessment and adaptation planning rely on context specific data and modelling. All these aspects taken together are needed in order to develop a strong technical basis for decision-making. Climate change risk assessments traditionally follow an analytical structure in which climate information is linked to impact models, and subsequently to damage models and decision-making tools such as cost-benefit analysis. The course introduces the different steps of climate change risk assessments in the context of decision making on climate change adaptation. The key focus is on understanding and exemplifying the use of different methodologies, and in this way to provide the students with hands-on experience with key tools and data systems as part of integrated climate risk assessments. This includes climate model data and hazard mapping, spatial analysis techniques, cost-benefit analysis and models for estimating damage costs and adaptation benefits. The course is divided into four major parts; 1) processing and analysis of climate data, 2) Modelling of the impacts of climate change, 3) Economic damage cost assessment and damage functions, 4) Cost benefit analysis and decision making on climate change adaptation. The learning objectives of this course are extensively supported by the use of relevant software within the different domains of climate risk assessments. This includes GIS, Scalgo, Mike by DHI and MATLAB.
danishContents: Samfundet står over for stigende risici fra klimaforandringer, især relateret til ekstreme begivenheder som skybrud, stormflod, vindstorme, hedebølger og tørke. Planlægning af og beslutningstagning vedrørende klimatilpasning er derfor højt prioriteret af regeringer, kommuner virksomheder og private husejere. Udviklingen af robuste og omkostningseffektive tilpasningsstrategier er en meget kompliceret proces, der involverer integreret risikovurdering af tidligere nævnte klimahændelser, deres tilknyttede virkninger som oversvømmelse, estimering af skadeomkostninger og vurdering af tilpasningsforanstaltninger, der til sammen kræver en tværfaglig tilgang samt tætte interaktioner mellem fagfolk og beslutningstagere. Endvidere er skadesomkostningerne og tilpasningsplanlægningen afhængige af kontekstspecifikke data og modellering. Alle disse aspekter er nødvendige for at kunne udvikle et stærkt teknisk grundlag for beslutningstagning. Risikovurderinger af klimaændringer følger traditionelt en analytisk struktur, hvor klimainformation er knyttet til konsekvensmodeller og efterfølgende skader modeller og beslutningstagningsværktøjer som cost-benefit analyse. Kurset introducerer de forskellige trin i risikovurderinger af klimaforandringer i forbindelse med beslutningstagning om klimatilpasning. Fokus er på at forstå og eksemplificere brugen af forskellige metoder og på den måde give eleverne praktisk erfaring med værktøjer og datasystemer som led i integrerede klimarisikovurderinger. Dette omfatter klimamodeldata og kortlægning af ekstreme klimahændelser, rumlige analyseteknikker, cost-benefit analyse og modeller til estimering af skadesomkostninger og klimatilpasning. Kurset er opdelt i fire hoveddele; 1) Bearbejdning og analyse af klimadata, 2) Modellering af impacts af Klimaændringer, 3) Økonomisk konsekvensvurdering og skadesfunktioner, 4) Cost-benefit analyse og beslutningstagning om klimatilpasning. Læringsmålene for dette kursus understøttes i vid udstrækning af brugen af relevant software inden for de forskellige områder af klimarisikovurderinger. Dette omfatter GIS, Scalgo, MIKE by DHI og MATLAB.
englishTitle: Climate Change Adaptation: Methods and tools

englishContents: The course includes first and foremost an introduction to environmental assessment of products and solutions in their life cycle through the use of simple tools. On this basis methods and tools are presented for the development of environmentally improved products and solutions. These methods and tools are applied in project work. Through the course social and management aspects of sustainability will be presented.
danishContents: Kurset omfatter først og fremmest en introduktion til miljøvurderinger af produkter/løsninger i deres livsforløb. Anvendelsen af simple værktøjer hertil gennemgås. På denne baggrund præsenteres metoder til at udvikle nye løsninger, som er mere miljørigtige. Metoder og værktøjer afprøves igennem projektarbejde. I løbet af kurset præsenteres sociale og ledelsesmæssige aspekter af bæredygtighed.

englishContents: This course aims at giving you experience in performing an analysis involving a combination of these aspects in order to optimize the success of a product innovation process.Based on examples of rapidly evolving technologies and assessment of development strategies for them, we study example cases of sustainable innovation, combined with state-of-art literature to give an overview of the methods being applied to guide the development.You will then formulate your own project and work in groups on a selected case of emerging technology, and during the course present your analysis in a presentation and report. The aim is to account for your choice of method and then to formulate a substantiated recommendation for optimal development of the technology you have been investigating. The presentation can be used for Grøn Dyst as well.The project cases will typically be based on an industrial collaborator, a research project, or a technology you find interesting in surveying to locate new potentials for innovation and development, maybe even in your further study and work after the course.The course hence gives a functional introduction and hands-on experience for performing basic actor network analysis, life cycle screening, and technology assessments, but given the time constraints it will not give a full in-depth explanation on these methods.
danishContents: Dette kursus har til formål at den studerende får erfaring med gennemførelse af en analyse, som kombinerer en række aspekter med henblik på at optimere en succesfuld produkt innovationsproces. Baseret på eksempler på teknologier i hurtig udvikling og vurdering af udviklingsstrategier fro dem, undersøger vi eksempler på bæredygtig innovation kombineret med state-of-the-art litteratur for at give et overblik over metoder anvendt til at guide udviklingen. Derefter formuleres eget projekt og der arbejdes i grupper på de udvalgte cases. I løbet af kurset præsenteres analysen i klassen samt i en rapport. Målet er at der skal redegøres for valg af metode samt formuleres en begrundet anbefaling til optimal videreudvikling af den undersøgte teknologi. Præsentationen kan også anvendes til "Grøn dyst". Cases vil typisk baseres på et virksomhedssamarbejde, et forskningsprojekt eller en teknologi den studerende finder interessant med henblik på at identificere nye potentialer for innovation og udvikling - måske ovenikøbet i de videre studier og arbejde efter kurset. Kurset giver således en funktionel introduktion og hands-on erfaring med gennemførelse af basal aktørnetværk analyse, livscyklusscreening, og teknologivurdering. Med det korte kursusforløb opnås dog ikke en fuldt uddybet forklaring på metoderne.

englishContents: The course consists of 33 contact hours organized in 10 blocks of 3x45 min, plus 3 contact hours for each group for supervision of the capstone project:-	1 joint introduction and overview-	9 topical blocks twice a weeko	Blok 1-3: Transforming energy systems- Trends in energy demand and supply at global to national scale; Decarbonization of energy systems; Smart energy systems- Economic and socio-technical perspetives on the transition to a sustainable energy system - Business and the governance of carbon emissions: global, transnational, national and local solutionso	Blocks 4-6: Waste and recycling systems-Waste and biorefining (@KU)-Recycling and reuse: a circular economy approach (@DTU)-Waste as a valuable resource: business models, innovation & entrepreneurship (@CBS)o	Blocks 7-9: Natural resources, food and agriculture systems-Sustainable food systems (@KU)-Sustainability assessment of natural resource use (@DTU)-Market approaches to the sustainability of natural resources: standards, labels and certifications (@CBS)Each 3-hour module includes o	Lectureso	group work on capstone projecto	groups include students from all 3 universities
danishTitle: Bæredygtighedsudfordringer II, Specifikke systemer og 'capstone' projekt
danishContents: Kurset består af 33 timer organiseret i 10 blokke af 3x45 min, samt 3 timers projektvejledning til hver gruppe:-1 fælles introduktion og overblik-9 emne-blokke, to gange ugentligto	Blok 1-3: Transforming energy systems- Trends in energy demand and supply at global to national scale; Decarbonization of energy systems; Smart energy systems- Economic and socio-technical perspetives on the transition to a sustainable energy system - Business and the governance of carbon emissions: global, transnational, national and local solutionso	Blok 4-6: Waste and recycling systems-Waste and biorefining (@KU)-Recycling and reuse: a circular economy approach (@DTU)-Waste as a valuable resource: business models, innovation & entrepreneurship (@CBS)o	Blok 7-9: Natural resources, food and agriculture systems-Sustainable food systems (@KU)-Sustainability assessment of natural resource use (@DTU)-Market approaches to the sustainability of natural resources: standards, labels and certifications (@CBS)Hvert 3-timer modul involverer o forelæsningero gruppearbejde på 'capstone' projekto grupperne inkluderer studerende fra alle 3 universiteter
englishTitle: Sustainability challenges II, Specific systems and capstone project

englishContents: The course provides an overview of components for a company sustainability strategy. The following are considered:•	A brief introduction to sustainability (Global perspectives, weak/strong sustainability, ecoefficiency/ecoeffectivenes, UN Sustainable Development Goals etc.).•	The sustainability strategy and CS(E)R framework of companies, including Organisational aspects, legislative framework/Regulatory context (e.g. Global compact, Environmental management systems), GRI reporting etc.•	Business related aspects, i.e. Technology and innovation, Sustainability Innovation, Business models/Sustainable business models, etc.. •	Circular economy and how it is increasingly becoming a strategic area for companies, Regulatory tendencies, introduction of C2C, Recycling issues for different types of materials, potentials of industrial symbiosis etc.•	Life Cycle Management; Introduction of LCA, identification of product systems and supply chain actors, stakeholders analysis etc. Introducing a simplified life cycle assessment methods/tool and discussing environmental and social performance indicators along the value chain.Throughout the course, lectures will be supplemented with exercises, group project work and individual assignments.
danishContents: se engelsk version

englishContents: A production model of either an industry, service or healthcare case is developed. A stakeholder analysis clarifies the strategy used in the design of the system. Alternative layouts are designed/assessed taking production technology (equipment/machinery, processes, sequences, buffers/warehouses, transport units, logistics etc.), information technology, production paradigms (lean/industry 4.0) and plans into account. The production/manufacturing system has to be Smart using the principles from lean and Industry 4.0. The level of automation and digitalization is decided related to both the material and information flow. The organization questions on core capabilities, outsourcing, skills and competences are evaluated. Considerations about life cycle/circular economy and maintenance of the system are analyzed.
danishTitle: Design af lean produktions- og servicesystemer
danishContents: En produktionsmodel af enten en industri, service eller sundhedscase udvikles. En interessentanalyse præciserer den strategi, der anvendes i systemets udformning. Alternative layouts designes / vurderes under anvendelse af produktionsteknologi (udstyr / maskiner, processer, sekvenser, buffers / lagre, transportenheder, logistik mv.), Informationsteknologi, produktionsparadigmer (lean / industri 4.0). Produktions-/servisesystemet skal være Smart ved hjælp af principperne fra lean og Industri 4.0. Niveauet for automatisering og digitalisering besluttes i relation til både materiale- og informationsflowet. Organisationensspørgsmål om kernekapacitet, outsourcing, færdigheder og kompetencer vurderes. Overvejelser om livscyklus / cirkulær økonomi og vedligeholdelse af systemet analyseres.
englishTitle: Design of Lean Production and Service Systems

englishContents: Introduction of the life cycle concept and the history of life cycle assessment. Application of LCA in industry and public organisations. Level of institutionalisation of LCA in an organisation. Purpose of using LCA in industrial production and management in a life cycle perspective. Presentation of methodological foundation of LCA step by step from goal and scope definition over inventory analysis and assessment of impacts on environment, resources and working environment to interpretation and sensitivity analysis. Operational parameters representing environment, work environment, resource use (energy, materials etc.), and social aspects. Introduction to the practical applications of LCA (eco-labelling, environmental management, product development, policy development etc.) Introduction of software tools supporting the practical performance of LCA. In parallel to the theoretical introduction the participants work in project teams applying the theory in practice in a life cycle assessment of a product or system, typically in collaboration with an external company. The course ends with presentation of own LCA report and critical review of the LCA report from one of the other groups.
danishContents: Introduktion til livscyklusbegrebet og livscyklusvurderingens historie. Anvendelser af LCA som vurderingsværktøj i industrien og i offentlige virksomheder. Institutionalisering af anvendelsen af LCA i en organisation. Anvendelse af LCA i industriel produktion og ledelse mm. i et livscyklusperspektiv. Gennemgang af livscyklusvurderingsmetodegrundlaget trin for trin fra måldefinition, afgrænsning og opgørelse over vurdering af miljø-, ressource- og arbejdsmiljøpåvirkninger til fortolkning og følsomhedsanalyse. Operationalisering af enkeltparametre med relation til ydre miljø, arbejdsmiljø, ressourceforbrug (energi, materialer m.m.), samt sociale aspekter. Gennemgang af LCA’s anvendelse i forskellige sammenhænge (miljømærker, miljøledelse, produktudvikling, politikudvikling mm.) Introduktion af hjælpeværktøjer til udførelsen af LCA. Parallelt med teorigennemgangen arbejdes i grupper med gennemførelsen af en livscyklusvurdering af et konkret produkt eller system, hvor den gennemgåede teori afprøves i praksis, typisk i samarbejde med en ekstern rekvirent. Kurset afsluttes med fremlæggelse af egen rapport fra projektarbejdet og kritisk granskning af rapporten fra en anden gruppes arbejde.
englishTitle: Life Cycle Assessment of Products and Systems

englishContents: Implementation: In the lectures, the basic concepts related to the field and various theoretical models for implementation will be studied. Indcluding the main reasons why and when implementation succeeds or fails, and the role and tasks of managers, employees and key personnel in the implementation process.Performance management: In the lectures, the basic concepts related to the field and the most widely used performance models will be examined. Including the impact of performance targets have on organizational behavior. Employee well-being/human factors: In the lectures, key concepts and models will be introduced including the importance of management of employee wellbeing during implementation processes. For both implementation, performance and wellbeing, theories and models will be applied and subsequently discussed in groups in connection with concrete cases.Finally comprehensive group work in association with a company is conducted with the aim to assess the company's  ability to implement new initiatives in an organizational context.
danishContents: Implementering: I forelæsningerne vil grundbegreber knyttet til området og forskellige teoretiske modeller for implementering blive gennemgået. Herunder de væsentligste årsager til hvorfor og hvornår implementering lykkes eller fejler, samt hvilken rolle og opgaver ledere, medarbejdere og nøglepersoner har i en implementerings proces. Performance Management: I forelæsningerne vil grundbegreber knyttet til området og de mest udbredte performance modeller blive introduceret. Herunder hvilken indflydelse performance mål har på organisatorisk adfærd. Medarbejder trivsel/Human factors: I forelæsninger og cases vil grundbegreber og modeller knyttet til området blive introduceret, herunder hvilken betydning ledelse har på medarbejder trivsel ifm. implementeringsprocesser. For både implementering, performance og medarbejdertrivsel gælder det at teori og modeller efterfølgende vil blive diskuteret i grupper i forbindelse med konkrete cases.Afslutningsvis gennemføres et samlet gruppearbejde i tilknytning til en virksomhed mhp. at vurdere virksomhedens implementering af en given ændring i en organisatorisk kontekst.

englishContents: Advanced product system modelling: construction and application of coupled parameterized products system models in open source software. Characterization models: Understanding of differences between recognized characterization models (ReCiPe, USEtox etc.) and coupling of these with own product system modelsModel sensitivity and uncertainty: Execution and assessment of product system model sensitivity and uncertainty analysisInventory models: Development of own simple inventory models, application of 3rd party models and implementation of results hereof
danishContents: Avanceret produktsystemmodellering: opbygning og anvendelse af koblede og parameteriserede produktsystemmodeller i open source software. Karakteriseringsmodeller: Forståelse af forskelle på kendte karakteriseringsmodeller (ReCiPe, USEtox etc.) samt kobling af disse med egne produktsystemmodeller Model-følsomhed/usikkerhed: Udførelse og evaluering af følsomheds og usikkerheds analyser af produktsystemmodellerInventory modeller: Udvikling af egne simple modeller, anvende 3. parts modeller samt implementere resultater herfra
englishTitle: Advanced system modelling and life cycle inventory analysis

englishContents: In a project work, a model of a patient / customer flow is created and analyzed. The flow is considered as a treatment/production flow within the healthcare / service area. Essential elements such as technology, logistics and performance in the flow are identified and possible connections between them tested. Relationship to other flow in the sector is analyzed. Different flow opportunities are established, analyzed and assessed. Various optimization criteria are developed, and an overall optimization and performance is described. The final model is simulated for verification and validation.
danishTitle: Operations management i sundheds- og servicesystemer
danishContents: I et projektarbejde designes og analyseres en model af et patient / kundeflow. Flowet betragtes som et behandlings- / produktionsflow. Væsentlige elementer som teknologi, logistik og performance i flowet identificeres og eventuelle forbindelser mellem dem testes. Forholdet til andre flow i sektoren analyseres. Forskellige flowmuligheder etableres, analyseres og vurderes. Forskellige optimeringskriterier udvikles, og en overordnet optimering og performance beskrives. Den endelige model simuleres, verificeres og valideres.
englishTitle: Operations Management in Health Care and Service Systems

englishContents: Introduction to the concept of life cycle thinking and to Life Cycle Management (LCM) incl. its history. Examples of applications of LCM in industry and public organisations, incl. related to Circular Economy and the UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). Introduction to the implementation processes of LCM in an organisation, incl. design and use of Key Performance Indicators (KPIs). Review of Life Cycle Assessments (LCAs) and their use as an assessment tool for environmental effects, incl. simplified versions such as Screening LCAs, MECO analyses (Materials, Energy, Chemicals, Other), and Greenhouse gas (GHG) accounting/Carbon Footprinting. Introduction to stakeholder analysis and its application. Review of tools to support typical decisions in the various stages of the product life cycle - both quantitative calculation programs for environmental and rough economic assessments - and qualitative environmental tools such as design guidelines.
danishContents: Introduktion til livscyklusbegrebet og livscyklusledelse/LCM inkl. deres historie. Eksempler på anvendelser af LCM i industrien og i offentlige organisationer, inkl. ift. Circular Economy og FN's Verdensmål (SDGs). Introduktion til implementeringsprocesser af LCM i en organisation, inkl. udformning og anvendelse af Key Performance Indikatorer (KPIer). Gennemgang af livscyklusvurdering/LCA og dens anvendelse som vurderingsværktøj for miljømæssige effekter, inkl. forenklede versioner som Screening LCAer, MEKA-analyser (Materialer, Energi, Kemikalier, Andet) og Greenhouse gas (GHG) accounting/Carbon Footprinting. Introduktion til stakeholder-analyse og dens anvendelse. Gennemgang af værktøjer til støtte for typiske beslutninger i de forskellige faser af et produkts livscyklus – både kvantitative beregningsprogrammer til miljømæssige og grove økonomiske vurderinger – og kvalitative miljøværktøjer, f.eks. designguidelines.

englishContents: The course will be divided into three main sections: (i) overview, understanding and modeling steps of different impact assessment methods and their application fields; (ii) introduction into principles, analysis and development of impact pathways and quantification of environmental fate, exposure and effects of life cycle-based impacts; (e) rank and recommend best-in-class options based on quantified impacts and communicating results in a consistent, reliable and transparent way to decision makers and stakeholders.
danishTitle: Sundheds-, miljø-, og livscykluseffekter i forskellige rammer
danishContents: The course will be divided into three main sections: (i) overview, understanding and modeling steps of different impact assessment methods and their application fields; (ii) introduction into principles, analysis and development of impact pathways and quantification of environmental fate, exposure and effects of life cycle-based impacts; (e) rank and recommend best-in-class options based on quantified impacts and communicating results in a consistent, reliable and transparent way to decision makers and stakeholders.
englishTitle: Health, environmental and life cycle impacts in different assessment frameworks

englishContents: Probability theory and statisticsMathematical programmingMultiobjective optimizationInventory managementDistribution planningProduction system analysisProduction planningMachine scheduling
danishContents: Probability theory and statisticsMathematical programmingMultiobjective optimizationInventory managementDistribution planningProduction system analysisProduction planningMachine scheduling

englishContents: During this course, a number of management tasks related to development and execution of production will be examined, including the interrelation of production with a number of other functions within a company.The course will cover the following subjects: Analysis of the production task. Development of production concept. Analysis of specification processes, and development of specification processes and how these can be supported by production configuration systems.Throughout the course, students will have to do an exercise where they will have to analyse the production task of a case company, develop a future production system, and analyse and develop the specification processes of the company.
danishContents: Kurset behandler styrings- og ledelsesmæssige opgaver i tilknytning til udvikling og gennemførelse af produktion, herunder produktionens samspil med en række andre funktioner i virksomheden.Indholdsmæssigt vil kurset være bygget op om emnegrupperne:Analyse af produktionsopgaven. Udvikling af produktions koncept. Analyse af specifikationsprocesser, samt udvikling af specifikationsprocesser og hvorledes disse kan understøttes af produktkonfigureringssystemer.Kurset omfatter en gennemgående øvelse, hvor man for en case virksomhed skal analysere produktionsopgaven, udvikle det fremtidige produktionssystem, samt analysere og udvikle virksomhedens specifikationsprocesser.

englishContents: Basic engineering economy concepts and models in the areas of 1) production theory (the possible or potential production methods), 2) theory of costs, 3) theory of markets (the relations between enterprise and markets), 4) theory of optimisation (the selection of plans for production by combining  informations of cost and market and 5) cost accounting/calculation (imputed costs, cost distribution). In order to illustrate by example, the solution of typical engineering economy problems is part of the lectures on the topics 1 to 5.
danishContents: Gennemgang af driftsøkonomiske grundbegreber og modeller inden for: 1) produktionsteori (virksomhedens produktionstekniske muligheder), 2) omkostningsteori, 3) afsætningsteori (virksomhedens relationer til markedet), 4) optimeringsteori (virksomhedens produktionsvalg ved kombination af omkostnings- og afsætningsmæssige forhold) og 5) kalkulation (fordeling af omkostninger på produkter). Under gennemgang af 1) - 5) gennemregnes og løses en række forskellige teknisk økonomiske problemstillinger, som ingeniører typisk konfronteres med.

englishContents: The course focuses on teaching the students to design, build and use discrete event-based simulation models for analyses of problems within operations management. Based upon a wide range of specific complex planning problems it will be discussed how simulation models can be used to obtain knowledge on the system's operating performance. The students are taught to analyse complex systems within operations management and to define relevant key performance indicators. The students are given an introduction to a discrete event-based simulation tool through a number of small-scale practical assignments and introductory lectures. Hereafter, the students are given a larger case study in which a specific simulation problem is solved. For the case study a written report is prepared and handed in at the end of the course.
danishContents: Kurset fokuserer på at indlære de studerende at designe, bygge og anvende diskret event-baserede simulationsmodeller til analyse af problemstillinger inden for operations management. Ud fra en række konkrete eksempler på komplekse planlægningsproblemer diskuteres hvordan simulation kan bibringe viden om det pågældende systems performance i en driftssituation. De studerende indlærer at analysere komplekse systemer inden for operations management og lærer blandt andet at opstille relevante key performance indikatorer. De studerende indføres i et diskret event-baseret simuleringssprog gennem en række mindre opgaver og oversigtsforelæsninger. Herefter gennemfører de studerende et større case studie, hvor en konkret opgave løses. For case-studiet udarbejdes en skriftlig rapport der afleveres ved kursets afslutning.

englishContents: The course starts with the working situation for the individual through theories of individual behaviour (including motivation). The relation between people in organizations is examined through theories on groups, roles and team development, communication, decision making, conflicts, power and participation, and situational leadership. At organizational level subjects as efficiency, structure, strategy and management, culture, the relation between organizations and environment and organizational change is illuminated.
danishContents: Kurset tager sit udgangspunkt i det enkelte menneskes arbejdssituation, som behandles ud fra teorier om individuel adfærd. Samspillet mellem mennesker i organisationen belyses med teorier om gruppeadfærd, herunder f.eks. kommunikation, beslutninger, konflikter, magt og indflydelse og situationsbestemt ledelse. På organisationsniveauet behandles emner som effektivitet, struktur, strategi og styring, samspillet med omgivelserne, kultur samt organisationsændringer.

englishContents: Projects are integral to engineering work. Indeed, we argue that project management is the second most important skill of engineers. Therefore, project management competences are fundamental to all DTU students. Through the course, the student develops unique insights into how project management is practiced through the analysis of a "real" world project. Furthermore, each student will experience the role of the project manager as each student will be responsible for planning and executing at least one day of the group work.The course is organized around classical and online lectures, reading material, group exercises/games and assignments, peer-reviews and multiple-choice quizzes. As a large portion of the learning activities take place in group’s, class participation is fundamental!Through the group work, the students will analyze a real life project. Here they are expected to apply tools, concepts, models and theories, both appropriately and critically, to understand the reasons for the project ‘success’ or ‘failure’, identify challenges and develop recommendations.IMPORTANT (TO DO PRIOR TO THE BEGINNING OF THE COURSE): Every student are expected to identify an exciting project and present it to the class in the first day. The project should be completed or close to completion, so it is possible to analyze its ‘success’. The lectures will be in English and we strongly encourage the students to write the final report in English. By far most Bachelor courses are in Danish. However, courses at Master level are mostly if not exclusively in English. In order to facilitate the transition, DTU encourages use of English language in some Bachelor courses. This course is one of them. If the student do not feel comfortable with English, they are allowed to write the report in Danish.
danishContents: Projekter er en central del af ingeniørarbejde. Faktisk hævder vi, at projektledelse er den anden vigtigste ingeniørkompetence. Derfor er projektledelseskompetencer grundlæggende for alle DTU-studerende.Gennem kurset vil den studerende udvikle unik indsigt i, hvordan projektledelse praktiseres gennem analyse af et konkret projekt. Desuden vil den studerende også opleve rollen som projektleder, da hver enkelte deltager vil være ansvarlig for planlægning og eksekvering mindst én dags gruppearbejde.Kurset er organiseret omkring klassiske og online forelæsninger, lærebøger, gruppeøvelser / spil og opgaver, peer-reviews og multiple-choice tests. Da en stor del af læringsaktiviteterne foregår i grupperne er en aktiv deltagelse afgørende!Gennem gruppearbejdet, vil de studerende analysere et konkret projekt. Her forventes de at anvende værktøjer, begreber, modeller og teorier hensigtsmæssigt og kritisk, for at forstå årsagerne til projektets ”succes" eller" fiasko ", identificere udfordringer og udvikle anbefalinger.VIGTIGT (AT FORBEREDE INDEN KURSUSSTART): Hver studerende forventes at identificere et spændende projekt (studieobjekt) og præsentere det for klassen i den første dag. Projektet skal være afsluttet eller næsten afsluttet, så det er muligt at analysere "succesen".Forelæsningerne gennemføres på engelsk og vi vil kraftigt opfordre de studerende til at skrive den endelige rapport på engelsk. Langt de fleste bachelorkurser er på dansk. Men kurser på master-niveau er for det meste, hvis ikke udelukkende på engelsk. For at lette overgangen, tilskynder DTU brug af engelsk i enkelte bachelorkurser. Dette kursus er et af dem. Hvis den studerende ikke føler sig tryg med ved at kommunikere på engelsk, kan rapporten skrives på dansk.

englishContents: Projects are integral to engineering work. Indeed, we argue that project management is the second most important skill of engineers. Therefore, project management competences are fundamental to all DTU students. Through the course, the student develops unique insights into how project management is practiced through the analysis of a "real" world project. Furthermore, each student will experience the role of the project manager as each student will be responsible for planning and executing at least one day of the group work.The course is organized around classical and online lectures, reading material, group exercises/games and assignments, peer-reviews and multiple-choice quizzes. As a large portion of the learning activities take place in group’s, class participation is fundamental!Through the group work, the students will analyze a real life project. The project should be completed or close to completion, so it is possible to analyze its ‘success’. The lectures will be in English and we strongly encourage the students to write the final report in English. By far most Bachelor courses are in Danish. However, courses at Master level are mostly if not exclusively in English. In order to facilitate the transition, DTU encourages use of English language in some Bachelor courses. This course is one of them. If the student do not feel comfortable with English, they are allowed to write the report in Danish.
