Derfor er projektledelseskompetencer grundlæggende for alle DTU-studerende.Gennem kurset vil den studerende udvikle unik indsigt i, hvordan projektledelse praktiseres gennem analyse af et konkret projekt. Desuden vil den studerende også opleve rollen som projektleder, da hver enkelte deltager vil være ansvarlig for planlægning og eksekvering mindst én dags gruppearbejde.Kurset er organiseret omkring klassiske og online forelæsninger, lærebøger, gruppeøvelser / spil og opgaver, peer-reviews og multiple-choice tests. Da en stor del af læringsaktiviteterne foregår i grupperne er en aktiv deltagelse afgørende!Gennem gruppearbejdet, vil de studerende analysere et konkret projekt. Her forventes de at anvende værktøjer, begreber, modeller og teorier hensigtsmæssigt og kritisk, for at forstå årsagerne til projektets ”succes" eller" fiasko ", identificere udfordringer og udvikle anbefalinger.VIGTIGT (AT FORBEREDE INDEN KURSUSSTART): Hver studerende forventes at identificere et spændende projekt (studieobjekt) og præsentere det for klassen i den første dag. Projektet skal være afsluttet eller næsten afsluttet, så det er muligt at analysere "succesen".Forelæsningerne gennemføres på engelsk og vi vil kraftigt opfordre de studerende til at skrive den endelige rapport på engelsk. Langt de fleste bachelorkurser er på dansk. Men kurser på master-niveau er for det meste, hvis ikke udelukkende på engelsk. For at lette overgangen, tilskynder DTU brug af engelsk i enkelte bachelorkurser. Dette kursus er et af dem. Hvis den studerende ikke føler sig tryg med ved at kommunikere på engelsk, kan rapporten skrives på dansk.

englishContents: The course will address three major areas that create challenges for project, program and portfolio management: 1. Complexity, with a particular focus on the relationship of technical and organizational complexity. 2. Uncertainty, with a focus on identifying and mitigating key risks and uncertainties throughout the long life cycles of engineering systems. And 3. Human behavior, addressing the social and organizational intricacies caused by public opinion formation as well as inner- and intra-organizational factors.The course will also address to major operational interfaces of project and program management, first, to the interdisciplinary design processes (e.g. systems engineering) and secondly, to business strategy and public policy.The course is built around three major activities: 1. Lectures and seminars, 2. Individual assignment resulting in a wiki entry on current challenges and/or best practices. Students will review their colleagues’ papers, and results will be presented. And 3. A group assignment in the form of a business case for organizational change is presented in class.
danishTitle: Avanceret ledelse af ingeniørprojekter, programmer og porteføljer
danishContents: The course will address three major areas that create challenges for project, program and portfolio management: 1. Complexity, with a particular focus on the relationship of technical and organizational complexity. 2. Uncertainty, with a focus on identifying and mitigating key risks and uncertainties throughout the long life cycles of engineering systems. And 3. Human behavior, addressing the social and organizational intricacies caused by public opinion formation as well as inner- and intra-organizational factors.The course will also address to major operational interfaces of project and program management, first, to the interdisciplinary design processes (e.g. systems engineering) and secondly, to business strategy and public policy.The course is built around three major activities: 1. Lectures and seminars, 2. Individual assignment resulting in a wiki entry on current challenges and/or best practices. Students will review their colleagues’ papers, and results will be presented. And 3. A group assignment in the form of a business case for organizational change is presented in class.
englishTitle: Advanced Engineering Project, Program and Portfolio Management

englishContents: Team Project: Early in the course we will form student groups (max. 6 students per group) who will work during the semester on a business project proposal. We will form these groups based on your information sheets. Team changes will not be allowed during the semester. Each team is expected to creatively identify 2 to 3 business opportunities, which the team analyses and evaluates. Over the course, you will refine and modify the most promising of these ideas and develop a business concept proposal. The refinement of your idea (market analyses, customer validation etc.) has to be documented. This documentation will be presented at mid-term. At the end of the semester, your team will present the final concept.Individual Project:The goal of this project is to challenge your entrepreneurial mind and increase your knowledge on key topics in entrepreneurship such as opportunity evaluation, business planning and growing a new venture. After the project write a summary critically discussing your personal take-aways. Provide an overview of one or two of your most important decisions and reasons for the way you decided. In your discussion take at least one of the class readings (cases or papers) and relate them to your experience with the simulation.
danishContents: Team Projekt: Tidligt i kurset vil vi danne grupper af studerende, der vil arbejde på et forretningsprojekt i løbet af semestret  (max 6 studerende per gruppe). Disse grupper vil blive dannet baseret på et spørgeskema. Team ændringer vil ikke blive tilladt i løbet af semesteret. Hver gruppe forventes at kreativt identificere, analysere og vurdere 2 til 3 forretningsmuligheder. I løbet af kurset vil gruppen forfine og videreudvikle den mest lovende af disse forretningsmuligheder og udvikle et forretningskoncept baseret på denne. Udbygningen af din forretningsmulighed (markedsanalyser, kunde validering etc.) skal dokumenteres. Denne dokumentation vil blive præsenteret midtvejs i kurset. I slutningen af semestret vil gruppen præsentere det endelige koncept. Individuelt Projekt: Målet med dette projekt er at udfordre dit ”entrepreneurial mindset” og øge din viden om centrale emner i virksomhedsstart såsom evaluering af nye muligheder, forretningsplanlægning og vækst af ny virksomhed. Efter projektet skal du skrive et resumé hvori du kritisk diskuterer dine personlige take-aways. Giv en oversigt over en eller to af dine vigtigste beslutninger og årsagerne til den måde du har handlet. I din diskussion skal du tage mindst et materiale fra pensum (case eller artikel) og relatere dem til din personlige oplevelse med simuleringen.

englishContents: The commercialization plan - some basic requirements Technology Roadmapping Opportunity Recognition: Defining Commercial Potential - Evaluation Business Models Entry StrategiesMarket Development & Customer Test Intellectual Property Issues and Patent searchFinancing Technology VenturesProduct Development goalsKey Risk factors
danishTitle: Kommercialisering af high tech koncepter,iværksætteri og videnskab  i aktion
danishContents: See English
englishTitle: Commercialization of high tech concepts, entrepreneurship and science in action

englishContents: 1. The business model  (timing and prioritization) 2. Customer and key stakeholder identification - Designing business experiments 3. Assessing opportunities and defining the Customer Value Proposition –  Value creation; Minimum Viable Product 4. Customer Relationship – Creating demand for the product  5. Customer segmentation and market approach for each - Market type, competition6. Distribution Channels - channel requirements/norms, channel partners and value distribution7. Partnerships & Deal Structuring – Who, when and with what consequence8. Resource leveraging –  Customer development team use of -IP, Financing, HR9. Key activities and International networks 10. Assessing revenue streams –Pricing models
danishTitle: (Before 42438) Business model design for growth entrepreneurship
danishContents: 1. The business model  (timing and prioritization) 2. Customer and key stakeholder identification - Designing business experiments 3. Assessing opportunities and defining the Customer Value Proposition –  Value creation; Minimum Viable Product 4. Customer Relationship – Creating demand for the product  5. Customer segmentation and market approach for each - Market type, competition6. Distribution Channels - channel requirements/norms, channel partners and value distribution7. Partnerships & Deal Structuring – Who, when and with what consequence8. Resource leveraging –  Customer development team use of -IP, Financing, HR9. Key activities and International networks 10. Assessing revenue streams –Pricing models
englishTitle: (Before 42438) Business model design for growth entrepreneurship

englishContents: Several DTU scientists working on an innovative early-stage technology have been identified prior to the start of this class (student’s own projects/inventions are possible, too). They will present their projects early in the course, and we will form student teams around these projects. As team heterogeneity plays a major role in opportunity identification, the lecturer will define the teams according to the individuals’ backgrounds. Each team is expected to creatively identify several market applications for the technology and evaluate their attractiveness. For the most promising idea, a firm creation roadmap will be developed. Each team is expected to come up with market opportunities that are innovative and that offer a real potential for high-growth and value creation. The opportunities should be an original effort of your team, not a copy or rework of someone else’s concept. The final goal is to develop a document detailing market assessments, the primary market opportunity and a firm creation roadmap. Overall, students will need to submit 4 assignments:1)	Team Presentation 1: Presentation of your core technology and your Market Opportunity Set 2)	Team Presentation 2: Present the evaluation of 3-4 Market Opportunities and your preferred choice3)	Team Presentation 3: Present your primary market opportunity in details and your Agile Focus Strategy 4)	Final report: Describe in details the 3 steps of the Market Opportunity Navigator and your primary market opportunity
danishTitle: Identifikation af markedsmuligheder for ny teknologi
danishContents: Kurset beskæftiger sig med en række teknologier udviklet af DTU forskere der befinder sig på et tidligt udviklingsstadie. Disse teknologier vil blive præsenteret af forskerene tidligt i kursets forløb, og deltagerne vil blive opdelt i grupper og tildelt en af disse teknologier (alternativt kan gruppen vælge at arbejde med en egenudviklet teknologi). Dette vil ske i blandede, heterogene grupper, tildelt af kursets undervisere baseret på deltagernes baggrund. Dette sker da en bred viden og samarbejde på tværs af tekniske discipliner spiller en stor rolle i identifikation af muligheder for den enkelte teknologi. Det forventes at hver gruppe identificerer flere forskellige markedsmuligheder for den tildelte teknologi og evaluere disse muligheders kommercielle potentiale. Der udvikles herefter et roadmap for den mest lovende mulighed. Det forventes at hver gruppe finder kreative og innovative markedsmuligheder med potentiale for høj vækst og værdiskabelse i markedet. Disse muligheder skal være nye og originale, og ikke en omskrivning eller kopi af eksisterende løsninger i markedet. Formålet med kurset er at producere en detaljeret markedsanalyse der identificerer den primære markedsmulighed, fordele og ulemper ved denne, samt et endeligt roadmap for hvordan denne mulighed skal udnyttes og teknologien kommercialiseres.Kurset består af fire afleveringer:1.	Gruppe præsentation #1: En præsentation af teknologien og de identificerede markedsmuligheder2.	Gruppe præsentation #2: Præsentation af gruppens evaluering af 3-4 markedsmuligheder og gruppens valg af marked3.	Gruppe præsentation #3: Detaljeret præsentation af den primære markedsmulighed og gruppens udviklede Agile Focus Strategy4.	Endelig rapport: Rapporten beskriver i detaljer de 3 trin af Market Opportunity Navigator og hvordan dette er brugt til at identificere den primære markedsmulighed

englishContents: The subjects treated will be the following:- Mass customization and modularization. Mass customization business models based on a modular product assortment.- A procedure for the development of specification systems and digitalisation of the company's business processes.- Methods for analyzing and modelling the product assortment to be implemented in product configurators.- Business and organisational consequences of the formalizing of engineering knowledge, including the perspectives of the exchange of engineering knowledge between companies cooperating on product development, production and marketing (virtual enterprises).- An overview of relevant standard systems and criteria for the choice of standard systems.- Principles for system development and modelling techniques (incl. object oriented modelling) for building up of product models based on the UML-standard.The course comprises 2 major compulsory workshops concerning:- The construction of a specification system including the development of a business process, the choice of ICT support and an general functional specification of the ICT systems that are to support the specification task.- The construction of a product model. The exercice includes an analysis and specification of a product model by using among other things object oriented modelling. Parts of the constructed product model is included in a standard system for configuration of products. In addition to this there will be short exercices for the learning of general methods and procedures.
danishContents: Kurset behandler følgende temaer.·Mass Customization og modularisering. Mass customization forretningsmodeller baseret på et modulopbygget produktsortiment.·Fremgangsmåde for analyse og udvikling af specifikationsprocesser, og digitalisering af virksomhedens forretningsprocesser. · Metoder for analyse af produktsortiment og opbygning af konfigureringssystemer.· Forretningsmæssige og organisatoriske konsekvenser ved formalisering af ingeniørviden.   Overblik over relevante standardsystemer til produktkonfigurering og kriterier for valg af standardsystem· Principper for systemudvikling og modelleringsteknikker (herunder objektorienteret modellering) for opbygning af konfigureringssystemer baseret på UML-standarden.  Principper for produktdatastyring (pdm).Kurset omfatter 2 større obligatoriske gruppearbejder vedrørende:Udvikling af specifikationssprocesser, valg af IKT-støtte og overordnet funktionel specifikation af de IKT-systemer, der skal understøtte specifikationsarbejdet.· Opbygning af et konfigureringssystem ved anvendelse af bl.a. objektorienteret modellering. Dele af den opbyggede produktmodel lægges ind i et standard-system forkonfigurering af produkter.Herunder korte øvelser for indlæring af generelle metoder og fremgangsmåder.
englishTitle: Mass Customization - application of product configuration

englishContents: The course is based on the completion of a project regarding the analysis and quantification of complexity costs. The project work will focus on one or more of the following elements:Principles of complexity management.Procedure for analysis and quantification of complexity costs of products and business processes. Identification and quantification of initiatives for reducing complexity of products and business processes.Students will have to prepare a project report, describing the project task and the project results.
danishContents: Kurset er baseret på gennemførelse af et projekt vedr. analyse og kvantificering af kompleksitetsomkostninger. Projektarbejdet vil fokusere på et eller flere af følgende elementer:Principper i complexity management.Fremgangsmåde for analyse og kvantificering af kompleksitetsomkostninger i produkter og forretningsprocesser. Identifikation og kvantificering af tiltag til at reducere kompleksitet i produkter og forretningsprocesser.Der udarbejdes en projektrapport, der beskriver projektopgaven og projektets resultater.

englishContents: Introduction to planning and schedulingDifferences between planning and scheduling in manufacturing and service industriesManufacturing: project scheduling, job shop scheduling, scheduling of flexible assembly systems, and economic lot scheduling. Services: reservations and timetabling, tournament scheduling, transportation, health care, and workforce scheduling.
danishTitle: Planning and Scheduling in Manufacturing and Services
danishContents: Introduction to planning and schedulingDifferences between planning and scheduling in manufacturing and service industriesManufacturing: project scheduling, job shop scheduling, scheduling of flexible assembly systems, and economic lot scheduling. Services: reservations and timetabling, tournament scheduling, transportation, health care, and workforce scheduling.
englishTitle: Planning and Scheduling in Manufacturing and Services

englishContents: Headlines for the lectures• Introduction to strategy from an engineers point of view• Analysing the Environment of the firm• Exploring strategic differentiation of organisations applying the Quadric framework• The theory of generic strategies • Diversification and strategy directions• Corporate identity and culture• The Resource Based View and Strategic Capabilities• Strategic scenarios• Technology Roadmapping
danishContents: Headlines for the lectures• Introduction to strategy from an engineers point of view• Analysing the Environment of the firm• Exploring strategic differentiation of organisations applying the Quadric framework• The theory of generic strategies • Diversification and strategy directions• Corporate identity and culture• The Resource Based View and Strategic Capabilities• Strategic scenarios• Technology Roadmapping

englishContents: The student will be introduced to theories and models on business models, organizational design, management and organization which are applied to solutions of specific problems in a number of cases.The students will also receive a specific challenge from a company. The students work in project groups in order to analyse and find solutions for the given challenge, and each group shall produce a report.There will be an individual multiple-choice test half-way through the semester.
danishContents: De studerende introduceres til et bredt udsnit af teorier og modeller indenfor forretningsmodeller, organisations design, ledelse og organisationsteori, som anvendes til løsning af konkrete problemstillinger i en række cases.De studerende præsenteres endvidere for et oplæg og en konkret udfordring fra en virksomhed. Denne udfordring skal analyseres og løses i projektgrupper, og hver gruppe skal udarbejde en afsluttende rapport.Der gennemføres en individuel multiple-choice test midtvejs i semesteret.
englishTitle: Technology, management, organisation and Business models (TEMO)

englishContents: This course encompasses literature on strategy and planning in organisations, interactive learning processes and a number of concrete strategy and planning methods, such as Future Workshop, Scenario Analysis, Strategic Roadmapping and Causal Mapping. The methods are applied by the students through exercises following each lecture. Additionally, the students have to work in depth with one method, which they apply to a real organisation or user group’s needs. The students gain knowledge and practical experience in planning and facilitating workshops for a user group. Skills that are commonly exercised by engineers in relation to product and organisation development, IT-development, as well as consultants within private and public sectors.
danishContents: Dette kursus introducerer til litteratur om strategi og planlægning i organisationer samt interaktive læringsprocesser og giver den studerende en række konkrete strategi- og planlægningsmetoder, såsom Future Workshop, Scenario Analysis, , Strategic Roadmapping, og Causal Mapping. De studerende får mulighed for at arbejde med alle metoderne gennem øvelser efter hver forelæsning. Derudover skal de studerende udvælge én metode, som de skal applicerer i en organisation eller konkret brugergruppe tilpasset deres behov. De studerende får herigennem viden og praktisk erfaring i at planlægge og facilitere workshops for en brugergruppe.

englishContents: The course focuses on the systemic management of organisational change and transition processes. It introduces core theories and models for change processes, from visioning the change, to delivering the change, and sustaining the change. A specific case of an organisaitonal transition based on the teachers research in the area of engineering-service transition in Danish manufacturing is used throughout the course to apply and exemplify the theories and models. In addition, specific examples are presented through guest lectures from a number of institutions. Based on the learnings in the course, the students will identify, investigate, and analyse a self-chosen practice case of organisational change.
danishContents: The course focuses on the systemic management of organisational change and transition processes. It introduces core theories and models for change processes, from visioning the change, to delivering the change, and sustaining the change. A specific case of an organisaitonal transition based on the teachers research in the area of engineering-service transition in Danish manufacturing is used throughout the course to apply and exemplify the theories and models. In addition, specific examples are presented through guest lectures from a number of institutions. Based on the learnings in the course, the students will identify, investigate, and analyse a self-chosen practice case of organisational change.
englishTitle: Management of Change in Engineering Systems

englishContents: This course approaches the management of technological innovation from a resource/knowledge based view, which sees technological innovations as a driving force of competitive advantage of organizations through a combination of internal resources and external linkages. Students are introduced to the theories, models, tools and practical cases from industries by understanding what technological innovations are, why they are important, and what are needed to enable and manage technological innovations within and outside of the boundary of organizations. Although most attention will be paid to innovations made by industrial firms, relevant issues of innovations at levels of individual, team, network of organizations, and industry will be addressed as well. The weekly readings consist of a mixture of book chapters, journal articles, and cases. In addition to ‘understanding’ technological innovations, students are also required to ‘practice’ innovations by developing a case study throughout the course and applying the knowledge learned from the course to the self-generated innovation case.
danishContents: Dette kursus anvender det ressource- og videns-baserede perspektiv til at studere innovation og innovationsledelse, og ser teknologisk innovation som en kilde til konkurrencemæssige fordele for organisationer gennem en kombination af interne ressourcer og eksterne relationer.De studerende bliver introduceret til teorier, modeller, værktøjer og relevante cases der har til formål at præsentere hvad teknologisk innovation er, hvorfor det er relevant og hvad der kræves for at muliggøre og styre teknologisk innovation både i og udenfor organisationer. Selvom det primære fokus er på innovation i teknologi-baserede virksomheder, arbejdes der også med innovation på andre niveauer, bl.a. individer, grupper, netværk og brancher.Pensum består af bogkapitler, videnskabelige artikler og cases.Ud over at opnå en teoretisk forståelse for teknologisk innovation, skal de studerende arbejde praktisk med innovation gennem løbende udvikling af en case.

englishContents: Introduction to challenges of data analytics projects in companies. Deriving a research model to analyse aspects and challenges of such projects. Define the business value of analytics projects. Discussing data quality issues. Typical data analytics process models. Technological challenges. Stakeholder Analysis. Data Analytics Strategy. During the course, a research model is used to explain management challenges in data analytics projects. Discussions, readings and mini-cases will give the participants the opportunity to discuss single aspects of management challenges and solutions. In an individual essay, every participant will dive into one of the theoretical topics from the curriculum, relates it with additional literature and writes an individual 2-page-essay.Within a project on real-world data, participants will apply their knowledge in a team and provide solutions. Each group will produce a management report.
danishContents: Introduction to challenges of data analytics projects in companies. Deriving a research model to analyse aspects and challenges of such projects. Define the business value of analytics projects. Discussing data quality issues. Typical data analytics process models. Technological challenges. Stakeholder Analysis. Data Analytics Strategy. During the course, a research model is used to explain management challenges in data analytics projects. Discussions, readings and mini-cases will give the participants the opportunity to discuss single aspects of management challenges and solutions. In an individual essay, every participant will dive into one of the theoretical topics from the curriculum, relates it with additional literature and writes an individual 2-page-essay.Within a project on real-world data, participants will apply their knowledge in a team and provide solutions. Each group will produce a management report.

englishContents: The classes are taught in an interactive manner, with theoretical parts, intermingled with practice with Jupyter Notebooks. Main topics are: Introduction to Python programming and Pandas, data visualisation, forecasting and regression models, classification, clustering, dimensionality reduction. The methods will be exemplified through different cases within e.g. transportation, management and marketing.
danishContents: The classes are taught in an interactive manner, with theoretical parts, intermingled with practice with Jupyter Notebooks. Main topics are: Introduction to Python programming and Pandas, data visualisation, forecasting and regression models, classification, clustering, dimensionality reduction. The methods will be exemplified through different cases within e.g. transportation, management and marketing.

englishContents: The classes are taught in an interactive manner, with theoretical parts, intermingled with practical exercises. The practical exercises can be done using any programming language of choice, however, programming support will be provided for Python only.The main topics covered in the course include data management; machine learning in research and production; modern trends in artificial intelligence in business context; spatio-temporal prediction models; recommender systems; web data analysis; network analysis; natural language processing basics; Bayesian optimisation and active learning.
danishContents: The classes are taught in an interactive manner, with theoretical parts, intermingled with practical exercises. The practical exercises can be done using any programming language of choice, however, programming support will be provided for Python only.The main topics covered in the course include data management; machine learning in research and production; modern trends in artificial intelligence in business context; spatio-temporal prediction models; recommender systems; web data analysis; network analysis; natural language processing basics; Bayesian optimisation and active learning.

englishContents: The course is an introduction to engineering work with focus on the following topics:• planning and decision support• strategy and systems design • etichs and sustainability• energy systems and transport systems • group work including giving / receiving feedback • self-management in study planning
danishContents: Kurset er en introduktion til ingeniørarbejde med fokus på følgende emner:• planlægning og beslutningsstøtte• strategi og systemdesign • etik og bæredygtighed• energisystemer og transportsystemer• gruppearbejde herunder give/modtage feedback• selvledelse i studieplanlægning

englishContents: The student will be introduced to theories and models of engineering systems, innovation and engineering work. The course is composed of a theoretical lectures and group work. Theories and models are applied to analysis of specific problems in cases.
danishContents: De studerende introduceres til modeller og teorier indenfor systemdesign, innovation og ingeniørarbejde. Kurset består at teoretiske forelæsninger og gruppearbejde. I kurset arbejdes med gennemgående cases, hvor konkrete problemstillinger analysers ved brug af teorier og modeller.

englishContents: The topics in the course will depend on the selected project. The detailed contents of the projects are defined in collaboration between the students and the supervisor. Project subjects are published before course start. The students may suggest projects themselves and find supervisors at DTU Management or DTU Compute.
danishContents: Kursets faglige indhold vil afhænge af det valgte projekt. Projektets indhold vælges af de studerende og vejledere i fællesskab. Forslag til emner offentliggøres inden kursusstart. De studerende kan desuden selv foreslå projekter og finde vejledere ved DTU Management  eller DTU Compute. Hvis der ønskes en vejleder fra et andet institut, skal emnet godkendes af den kursusansvarlige.
englishTitle: Project work - Strategic Analysis and Systems Design

englishContents: During the course, the planning problems and corresponding solution methods seen within the primary activities of a company will be discussed. These includes:- Supply chain management (SCM) and operations management (OM) exemplified through the learning game "The Beer Game"- Production processes, layout of production systems and Business Process Management- Quality and capacity management- Management of supplies - Logistics- Forecasting- Sales and Operations Planning- Inventory management- Production PlanningBoth the weekly exercises and the mandatory project assignments will be carried out using the Microsoft Excel spreadsheet software. These include basic data management as well as simple formula expressions, visualization (graphs and figures) and solving simple optimization problems using Microsoft Excel Solver.
danishTitle: Introduktion til Operations og Supply Chain Management
danishContents: Gennem kurset gennemgås de enkelte faglige problemstillinger og tilhørende løsningsmetoder inden for virksomhedernes primære aktiviteter. Dette omfatter:-	Forsyningskæder og operations management eksemplificeret gennem læringsspillet ”The Beer Game” -	Produktionsprocesser, layout af produktionssystemer og Business Process Management-	Kvalitets- og kapacitetsstyring-	Styring af indkøb-	Logistik-	Forecasting-	Sales and Operations Planning-	Lagerstyring-	ProduktionsplanlægningSåvel de ugentlige øvelsesopgaver som de obligatoriske projektopgaver vil blive gennemført i regnearkssoftwaren Microsoft Excel og omfatter såvel grundlæggende datahåndtering som simple formeludtryk, visualisering (grafer og figurer) samt løsning af simple optimeringsproblemer ved hjælp af Microsoft Excel Solver.
englishTitle: Introduction to Operations and Supply Chain Management

englishContents: The course is composed of a theoretical lectures and group discussions. The lectures will deal with the following four themes with argumentation and correct reasoning as common components in all themes:  - Philosophy of science. - Logic and reasoning. - Ethical theory and ethics of technology.  - Engineering with values, in particular safety, sustainability, and innovation.
danishContents: Kurset består af teoretiske forelæsninger og gruppediskussioner. Forelæsningerne vil omhandle følgende fire temaer, hvor argumentation og korrekt ræsonnering er gennemgående:- Videnskabsteori. - Logik og ræsonnering. - Etisk teori og teknologietik.- Ingeniørarbejde med værdier, særligt sikkerhed, bæredygtighed og innovation.

englishContents: The course consists of theoretical lectures and group discussions. The lectures will pertain to matters of -philosophy of science-logic-ethics and (other types of) normativity-values in engineering, e.g. risks and sustainability
danishContents: Kurset består af teoretiske forelæsninger og gruppediskussioner. Forelæsningerne vil omhandle følgende fire temaer, hvor argumentation og korrekt ræsonnering er gennemgående: - Videnskabsfilosofi. - Logik. - Etik og andre former for normativitet. - Ingeniørarbejde med værdier, særligt sikkerhed og bæredygtighed.

englishContents: The course coveres the following topics:a. introduction to economic theory, as a base for the the rest of the classb. external effects and public goodsc. environmental policies.The course comprises the following questions: 1. What is economic growth and how can we reach more sustainable growth if we choose so as a society?2. How can we model consumer behaviour especially wrt environmental services?3. How can we model production and how do firms make production decisions?4. How does a market equilibrium emerge and which factors influence it?5. Why do markets sometimes fail and what are the consequences for the environment? 6. What political measures can we take to overcome the adverse effect of market failures on the environment? 7. When do political measures work and what are their societal costs?
danishContents: Kurset behandler tre hovedområder:a. introduktion til økonomisk teori, som grundlag af den videre forløbb. eksterne effekter og public goodsc. miljøpolitikkerne.Kurset behandler de følgende spørgsmål: 1. Hvad er økonomisk vækst og hvordan kan vi nå mere grønt vækst, hvis vi vælger det som samfund?2. Hvordan kan vi modellere forbrugeradfærd især mhp miljøgoder?3. Hvordan kan vi modellere produktionsiden og hvordan træffes produktionsbesluttninger?4. Hvordan opstår et markedsligevækt og hvilke faktorer indvirker på ligevægtet?5. Hvorfor fejler markeder og hvad er konsekvenserne for miljøet?6. Hvilke politiske virkemidler kan vi anvende til at overkomme effekterne af markedsfejl til fordelen af miljøet?7. Hvornår virker de og hvad koster de?

englishContents: The course covers all of the topics contained within a modern investor pitch deck and business plan.  In addition, we cover topics related to technology risk mitigation, product/service-systems, pretotyping and MVPs, IPR, financing, value propositions, business modelling, segmentation & market estimation.  The cases are submitted by industry and research institutes.  The cases are in the form of a patent/technology or a technology related challenge. Every team will be joined by the inventor (project submitter) for the technical development and also a business mentor.The cases fall into two categories: Commercial Entrepreneurship and Social Entrepreneurship relating to the SDGs.  We will try to fit students to the category they are most interested in.The final deliverable of the course is the business pitch deck.  The course ends with spinout day where the students make a 4min business pitch plus 2 min tech demo in front of your examiners, investors and an audience.The business pitch deck has been approved for submission of the venture cup and the Danish tech challenge and can be submitted to both competitions on completion. There is also prototype fund available for each team.
danishContents: Kurset inkluderer alle de emner, man kan forvente at finde i en moderne investorpræsentation og forretningsplan. Derudover dækkes en række emner inden for håndtering af teknologiske risici, produkt/service-systemer, pretotyping og MVP'er, immaterielle rettigheder, value proposition, forretningsmodellering, segmentering- og estimering af marked.De enkelte cases kommer fra industrien og fra forskningsinstitutter. De er i form af patenter/teknologier eller i form af en teknologisk udfordring. "Opfinderen" (som er kommet med teknologien) bliver del af teamet med henblik på at støtte den tekniske udvikling og desuden bliver der påsat en forretningsorienteret mentor.Projekterne falder i to kategorier: Kommercielt eller Socialt iværksætteri - sidstnævnte med fokus på FNs SDG'er. Vi forsøger at placere de studerende i den type projekt de helst vil arbejde med.Kursets afsluttende aflevering er et "business pitch deck". Kurset ender med den såkaldte spin out day, hvor de studerende præsentere dette pitch deck i 4 min sammen med en 2 min lang teknologidemonstration. Dette foregår foran eksaminatorer, investorer og et større publikum.Business pitch deck'et er desuden godkendt til brug i ansøgning til både Venture Cup og Danish Tech Challenge og det derfor blive indsendt til disse konkurrencer efter kurset er afsluttet. Der er endvidere en prototypefond til rådighed for hvert team.

englishContents: The following topics are broached and treated:• A broad overveiw of sociotechnical approaches, with elaboration as to approaches from Science & Technology Studies (STS) as the primary vehicle for the course.• Ethnography and strategy-as-practice• Domestication and design for infrastructuring• Identifying, mapping and navigating actor re-configurations• Abductive Analysis• Generative Design Research and Generative Prototyping• Knowledge Mediation in and through Design• Analysing design issues relating to work processes and knowledge practices• Leveraging boundary objects toward analysis, intervention, and synthesis in design, planning and development.• Intermediary objects and sociomateriality in design  • The ordering of complexity and interdependencies in the planning of large technological projects• Boundary-drawing and managing tradeoffs in synthesis-oriented work: e.g. requirements specifications, generative business modelling.
danishContents: Den studerende præsenteres for og beskæftiger sig med en række eksemplariske studier af teknologi- og produktudvikling, samt en teoretisk og metodologisk funderet sæt af praktiske analytiske værktøjer, at behandle sådanne cases med.• Kort oversigt over sociotekniske tilgange, med særlig uddybning af de teknologi- og videnskabsstudie (science & technology studies - STS) relaterede, som grundlag for kursets sociotekniske faglighed.• Etnografi og strategi som praksis• Domesticering og design for infrastructuring• Identificering, kortlægning og navigering gennem aktørers re-konfiguration• Abduktiv analyse• Generativ design research og generativ prototyping • Vidensmediering i og gennem designprocesser• Analyse af design aspekter vedrørende arbejds- og videnprocesser• Grænseobjekter som 'sensitizing devices' - i analyse, intervention og syntese• Intermediary objects og sociomateriel design• Samordning af komplekse afhængighedsforhold i større teknologiske projekter• Grænsedragninger og håndtering af trade-offs i syntesearbejde: e.g. kravspecificering, generativ business modelling.

englishContents: The following topics will be adressed:- research design and philosophy- research methods including qualitative, quantitative and mixed-methods- managing a PhD project- Academic writing and publishing- Ethics in academic research
danishTitle: Research and PhD studies at DTU Management
danishContents: The following topics will be adressed:- research design and philosophy- research methods including qualitative, quantitative and mixed-methods- managing a PhD project- Academic writing and publishing- Ethics in academic research
englishTitle: Research and PhD studies at DTU Management

englishContents: Theoretical background for road traffic engineering, simulation of road transport, model integration in simulation programs and evaluation of solutions.
danishContents: Teoretisk baggrund for vejtrafikteknik, simulering af vejtrafik, modelopbygning i simuleringsprogrammer og evaluering af løsninger.

englishContents: The transport logistics provides the students with a factual perspective to role of the transport within the supply chain. Also, problem settings experienced in operational contexts in freight transport is being discussed. This will among others include the EU's transport policy, company logistics issues, the development of container transportation, the freight transportation modes and their use. The transport optimisation part of the course introduces a number of mandatory mathematical modelling exercises originating from problem settings within the freight transport and logistics sector. Consequently, a mathematical modelling tool which is used for solving a number of simple transport optimisation problems will be introduced.
danishContents: Transportlogistikken giver dels den faktuelle vinkel på transportens rolle i forsyningskæden  dels diskuteres godstransportsektorens daglige problemstillinger. Dette inkluderer fx virksomheders logistiske overvejelser, egenskaber ved diverse transportformer, udviklingen af containertransporten og EU’s transportpolitik. Under kurset involveres forskellige aktører fra godstransportsektoren via  gæsteforelæsninger og ekskursioner. Transportoptimeringen introducerer konkrete planlægningsproblemstillinger hentet fra godstransportsektoren. Der introduceres således et matematisk modellingsværktøj, der vil blive benyttet til løsning af simple transportoptimeringsproblemer.

englishContents: The course treats both basic and advanced theory and methodology in assessment/appraisal/evaluation of major investment projects for transport infrastructure. The methodologies applied are, however, universal and can be applied to other types of projects as well. Knowledge about transport infrastructure projects is not a prerequisite to participate in the course.The overall issue of the course is to apply socio-economic analysis using cost-benefit analysis (CBA), strategic analysis using multi-criteria decision analysis (MCDA) and risk analysis and combine them to a composite analysis for a pool of investment projects in order to provide the best possible decision support. The following topics will be treated in lectures and exercises, where it is assumed that the student holds some basic knowledge in economics:Socio-economic analysis: Basic methodology behind the CBA. The students will learn how to apply the methodology to analyse major investments over a long-time horizon.Strategic analysis: Theory and methodology concerning the measurement of non-quantifiable impacts, which often are of a strategic character and hold the potential of improving the decision support. The students will get acquainted with different MCDA assessment techniques to be used depending on the decision situation, and how to combine these with the results stemming from the cost-benefit analysis and risk analysis.Risk analysis: Theory and methodology concerning uncertainty calculations and the concept of Optimism Bias. A topic here is the determination of various uncertain elements in the socio-economic analysis.Sustainability: The Sustainable Development Goals defined by UN in 2015 have pushed for a new agenda when performing decision support, and a wide set of indicators are defined to measure the contribution of a project initiative to achieve one or more of the goals. In the course the aim is to include this sustainability perspective in the final recommendations as well.The course participants work in groups to apply and achieve practical knowledge about the analysis methods and concepts. It is expected that the students are able to clarify/account/argue for the chosen impacts/criteria and the model solutions in connection with the report work and the oral examination. The main course content consists of lectures and group exercises with plenary discussions.
danishContents: Kurset omhandler den basale teori samt metodegrundlag m.h.t. vurdering/evaluering af større investeringsprojekter. Der tages udgangspunkt i infrastrukturprojekter, men de anvendte metoder er imidlertid universelle og et kendskab til transportprojekter er ikke en forudsætning for at kunne følge kurset.Hovedformålet med kurset vil være at kunne anvende samfundsøkonomisk analyse vha. cost-benefit analyse (CBA), strategisk analyse vha. multi-kriterie analyse (MCDA) samt risikoanalyse og kombinere dem til en komposit analyse for et specifikt investeringsprojekt.  Følgende emner vil blive behandlet i forelæsninger og øvelser, hvor det forudsættes at den studerende har basalt kendskab til økonomisk teori: Samfundsøkonomisk analyse: Grundlæggende metode bag CBA. Kursusdeltagerne vil lære at anvende metoden til at analyse store investeringer over en længere tidshorisont.Strategisk analyse: Teori og metode vedrørende måling af ikke-kvantificerbare effekter, som ofte er af strategisk karakter og kan medvirke til at forbedre beslutningsstøtten. Kursusdeltagerne vil få kendskab til forskellige MCDA vurderingsteknikker, der kan anvendes afhængig af beslutningssituationen, samt viden om, hvordan disse kan kombineres med resultaterne fra risikoanalysen.Risikoanalyse: Teori og metode vedrørende usikkerhedsberegninger og såkaldt ”optimism bias”. Herudover lægges der vægt på bestemmelse af usikre elementer/effekter i den samfundsøkonomiske analyse. Kursusdeltagerne vil arbejde med ovennævnte metoder og begreber i grupper. Det forventes, at de studerende vil kunne tydeliggøre/redegøre for de valgte effekter/kriterier og den resulterende modelløsning i forbindelse med såvel afrapportering som den mundtlige eksamen. Hovedkursusindholdet vil bestå af forelæsninger og gruppeøvelser inkl. plenumdiskussioner og præsentationer.

englishContents: Railway specific technology and management science, with emphasis on how to select and manage technology to provide effective and financially viable transport services. The concerns of engineers and service managers are presented in an integrated manner. The course leads to more specialised courses within railways and to more advanced courses in scientific management.
danishContents: Jernbanespecifik teknologi og ledelsesteori. Der lægges i kurset vægt på, at de studerende indlærer, hvordan teknologi til jernbaner udvælges og ledes for dermed at sikre et transportsystem der er såvel effektivt som økonomisk rentabelt. Kurset giver en integreret præsentation af de problemstillinger som ingeniører og ledere oplever inden for jernbanesektoren. Kurset leder op til mere avancerede kurser inden for såvel teknologi som ledelse af jernbaner.

englishContents: The course applies statistical concepts and models used for analysis of transport and mobility data as well as other social data. The course is organised around four modules. The first relates to data management and applied statistics. The second concerns applied linear regression in a societal context. The third applies generalised linear models to social data, e.g. traffic safety data, and the final module consists of a project that applies relevant models to a self chosen data set.
danishTitle: Statistisk analyse af mobilitet og transport
danishContents: Kurset introducerer statistiske metoder, som anvendes til modellering af data vdr. samfundet, herunder mobilitet og transport. Kurset er organiseret omkring fire moduler. Det første modul omhandler databehandling og anvendt statistik. Den næste omhandler anvendt lineær regression på samfundsmæssige problemstillinger. Det tredje omhandler modellering af data vha. generaliserede lineære modeller. I det sidste modul anvendes relevante modeller på et selvvalgt datasæt.
englishTitle: Statistical analysis of mobility and transport

englishContents: The content will be in two stages (approx. 1 week each): concepts and methodologies, provided by instructor and DTU faculty; tools and challenges, provided by invited lecturers from private and public sector. The goal is to design feasible solutions for real-world challenges, using the concepts learned. Stage 1: The concept of the “Smart City” and ITS and the interactions between transport and other systems (e.g. energy, environment) through new technologies. Introduction to systems approach, where the inputs, outputs and the ”boundaries” of a system are clearly delineated, with specific focus on decision variables (that effect the system) and system evaluation. Enhancement of transportation through new technologies including data sciences tools (from data preparation to regression/classification/clustering, to visualisation), autonomous vehicles, Vehicle to Vehicle (V2V) communication, smartphone apps, and new sensors. Stage 2: The role of new and mature tools (e.g. software, sensors, new devices) in the future of mobility. Current grand challenges for mobility in our cities, how to approach them, assess the potentials of solutions and design their implementation.
danishContents: Indholdet vil være opdelt i 2 moduler (varighed ca. 1 uge pr. modul): koncept og metodik, leveret af instruktører og DTU’s fakultet; værktøjer og udfordringer, leveret af gæsteforelæsere fra hhv. den private og offentlige sektor. Målet er at designe mulige løsningsmodeller til virkelige udfordringer ved hjælp af de tillærte begreber.Modul 1:  ”Smart City” konceptet og ITS og interaktionen mellem transport og andre systemer (f.eks. energi og miljø) gennem nye teknologier. Introduktion til systemisk tilgang hvor input, output og et systems ”grænser” bliver tydeligt beskrevet med specifikt fokus på beslutningsvariable (som påvirker systemet) og systemevaluering. Forbedring af transport gennem nye teknologier inkl. datavidenskabelige metoder (fra dataforberedelse til regression/klassifikation/gruppering, til visualisering), førerløse transportmidler, Vehicle to Vehicle (V2V) kommunikation, smartphone apps og nye sensorer.Modul 2: Nye og fuldt udviklede værktøjer (f.eks. software, sensorer, nye enheder) til fremtidens mobilitet. Omfattende nuværende udfordringer for mobilitet i vore byer, hvad skal fremgangsmåden være, vurdere løsnings potentialer og designe implementering af disse.

englishContents: Overview of the various logistics problems in shipping and ports. The international, regional and sectoral policy context. Innovation drivers and triggers in maritime logistics sectors. Tramp and liner shipping logistics basics. Speed optimization and combined speed-routing models. Weather routing. Liner shipping network design. Balancing environmental vs. economic performance. Greenhouse gas and sulphur abatement and their impact on maritime logistics. Port logistics basics. Port governance models. Generalized costs and hinterland connections. Terminal management problems. Port security. Green ports. Cross-linkages between ship and port logistics. Autonomous shipping and digitalization. Maritime cyber-security.The course assignment will be each student (or student groups) to critically review a number of related papers, and work on a final project that will address a major shipping or port logistics challenge.
danishContents: Oversigt over de forskellige logistikproblemer i shipping og havne. Den internationale, regionale og sektorpolitiske kontekst. Innovationsdrivere og udløsere i maritime logistik sektorer. Tramp og linje shipping i grundlæggende logistik. Hastighedsoptimering og kombinerede speed-routing modeller. Vejr routing, liner shipping og network design. Afbalancering af miljøet mod økonomiske resultater. Drivhusgas og svovlbekæmpelse og deres indvirkning på søfartslogistik. Port logistik basics. Port governance modeller. Generelle omkostninger og bagvedliggende forbindelser. Terminal management problemer. Havnesikring, Grønne havne og koblinger mellem skibs- og havlogistik. Autonome forsendelser og digitalisering. Maritime cybersikkerhed.Kursusopgaven vil være udformet således at hver elev (eller elevgrupper) kritisk gennemgår en række relaterede artikler og arbejder på et endeligt projekt, der skal tage højde for en stor shipping- eller portlogistikudfordring.

englishContents: The course starts with the working situation for the individual through theories of individual behaviour (including motivation). The relation between people in organizations is examined through theories on groups, roles and team development, communication, decision making, conflicts, power and participation, and situational leadership. At organizational level subjects as efficiency, structure, strategy and management, culture, the relation between organizations and environment and organizational change is illuminated.
danishContents: Kurset tager sit udgangspunkt i det enkelte menneskes arbejdssituation, som behandles ud fra teorier om individuel adfærd. Samspillet mellem mennesker i organisationen belyses med teorier om gruppeadfærd, herunder f.eks. kommunikation, beslutninger, konflikter, magt og indflydelse og situationsbestemt ledelse. På organisationsniveauet behandles emner som effektivitet, struktur, strategi og styring, samspillet med omgivelserne, kultur samt organisationsændringer.

englishContents: Work with topics within planning and public transport. Introduction to the role of public transport in transport planning. Characteristics and effects of various public transport systems. Need assessments for implementation of public transport. Station vicinity. Data sources and data collection. Public transport organization. Design and planning of public transport networks and timetable planning, amongst other introduction to tools and methods. Intelligent Transport Systems in public transport. Passenger preferences and satisfaction.
danishContents: Der arbejdes med emner inden for planlægning af kollektiv transport. Introduktion til kollektiv transports rolle i overordnet trafikplanlægning. Karakteristika og effekter af forskellige kollektive transportsystemer. Behovsanalyser for implementering af kollektiv transport. Stationsnærhed. Datakilder og dataindsamling. Organisering af kollektiv transport. Udformning og planlægning af kollektive transportnetværk og køreplanlægning, herunder introduktion til værktøjer og metoder. Intelligente transportsystemer inden for kollektiv transport. Passagerpræferencer og -tilfredshed.

englishContents: Lectures on special issues concerning planning of public transport. GIS-based analyses of accessibility, including regional accessibility and station vicinity. Choice of stop locations, stopping patterns and timetable. Correspondences. Traffic and route choice models for public transport, including models based on stochastic utility theory. GIS based methods to handle public transportation networks. Induced traffic for larger transport projects. Strategic impacts. Operation economic and socio-economic appraisal of public transport. The main focus in the course is to use the treated methods to complete a specific public planning project as part of the reporting. ArcGIS is used as the general software tool.
danishContents: Gennemgang af særlige forhold for planlægning af kollektiv transport. GIS-baserede tilgængelighedsanalyser, herunder regional tilgængelighed og stationsnærhed. Valg af standsningssteder, driftsoplæg og køreplanlægning. Korrespondancer. Trafik og rutevalgsmodeller for kollektiv trafik, herunder modeller baseret på stokastisk nytteteori. GIS-baserede metoder til håndtering af kollektive trafiknet. Trafikspring for større trafikprojekter. Strategiske effekter. Drifts- og samfundsøkonomisk vurdering af kollektiv transport. Hovedvægten i kurset er løsning af et kollektivt planprojekt som led i afrapporteringen. ArcGIS benyttes som gennemgående værktøj.

englishContents: The theory of the 4-stage model is presented.Route choice calculations are performed using Traffic Analyst and ArcGIS for a small test network as preparation for the project work.A road project in the Metropolitan area is coded, modelled and evaluated with respect to the traffic impacts. This includes specification of the project, overall need analysis, choice and coding of the alignment, estimating construction costs, calculation of route choice, induced traffic and other traffic impacts. The road project is evaluated by means of a cost-benefit analysis.
danishContents: Teorien bag 4-trins modellen gennemgåes. Rutevalgsberegninger gennemføres med Traffic Analyst og ArcGIS på et testnetværk som forberedelse til projektarbejdet.Et vejprojekt i Hovedstadsregionen kodes, modelleres og trafikkonsekvensvurderes. Dette inkluderer projektkonkretisering, overordnet behovsanalyse, valg og kodning af linieføring, estimat af anlægsomkostning, beregning af rutevalg, trafikspring og øvrige transporteffekter. Vejprojektet vurderes vha. en cost-benefit analyse.

englishContents: The course will have a strong, practical focus. The object is to make the student able to use GIS for handling of large dataset, both for visulizing the data and also for small analysis.Through variatios exercises raw data will be collecting and appropriated. There will be map production and geospatial analysis, so that the student through digital map making can delve deeper into the topic of mobility.
danishContents: Kurset har en meget praktisk fokus. Nemlig at sætte den studerende i stand til at anvende GIS til behandling af store mængder data, både med henblik på visualisering af data og til mindre analyser.Gennem forskellige øvelser vil der blive arbejdet med indsamling og bearbejdning af rådata, samt opsætning af kort og geospatiale  analyser, således at der i sidste ende produceres digitale kort, der kan bruges til at komme dybere ned i begrebet mobilitet.

englishContents: Theoretical background for road traffic technique, simulation of road transport, model integration in simulation programs and evaluation of solutions.
danishContents: Teoretisk baggrund for vejtrafikteknik, simulering af vejtrafik, modelopbygning i simuleringsprogrammer og evaluering af løsninger.

englishContents: The transport logistics provides the students with a factual perspective to role of the transport within the supply chain. Also, problem settings experienced in operational contexts in freight transport is being discussed. This will among others include the EU's transport policy, company logistics issues, the development of container transportation, the freight transportation modes and their use. The transport optimisation part of the course introduces a number of mandatory mathematical modelling exercises originating from problem settings within the freight transport and logistics sector. Consequently, a mathematical modelling tool which is used for solving a number of simple transport optimisation problems will be introduced.
danishContents: Transportlogistikken giver dels den faktuelle vinkel på transportens rolle i forsyningskæden dels diskuteres godstransportsektorens daglige problemstillinger. Dette inkluderer fx virksomheders logistiske overvejelser, egenskaber ved diverse transportformer, udviklingen af containertransporten og EU’s transportpolitik. Under kurset involveres forskellige aktører fra godstransportsektoren via gæsteforelæsninger og ekskursioner. Transportoptimeringen introducerer konkrete planlægningsproblemstillinger hentet fra godstransportsektoren. Der introduceres således et matematisk modellingsværktøj, der vil blive benyttet til løsning af simple transportoptimeringsproblemer.

englishContents: The course covers the basic theory and methodology with regard to the assessment/evaluation of a transport project. The main objective will be to apply the concept of sustainability and cost-benefit analysis within a specific transport-related problem area. The students will in this context be introduced to socio-economic assessments including a number of software solutions. The following topics will be addressed in lectures and exercises:Sustainability: the 3 dimensions consisting of environmental, social aspects and economy are introduced and operationalized in the transport sector. It is outlined what sustainable transport solutions consist of, and how the Danish planning process can be developed in a more sustainable direction.Cost-benefit analysis (CBA): Review of relevant concepts and terms such as net present value, the benefit/cost ratio, internal rate of return, discounting, etc.. Involvement of transport-related effects such as travel time savings, construction costs, maintenance and operation, environmental aspects, etc.. The analytical method will be based on the spreadsheet model, TERESA (Ministry of Transport Spreadsheet Model for Socio-economic Analysis). Finally, special attention is paid to the provision of appropriate and relevant input data as well as key figures from the latest key figure catalog for transport economic unit prices.Qualitative analyses of the transport effects that cannot be assigned monetary values. Point of departure is taken in EIA (Environmental Impact Assessments)  and their use in the planning process.
danishContents: Kurset omhandler den basale teori samt metodegrundlag m.h.t. vurdering/evaluering af et transportprojekt. Hovedformålet vil være at kunne anvende bæredygtighedsbegrebet og cost-benefit analyse på et specifikt transportrelateret problemområde. Den studerende vil i denne sammenhæng blive introduceret for samfundsøkonomiske vurderinger bl.a. ved hjælp af en softwareløsning. Følgende emner vil blive behandlet i forelæsninger og øvelser:Bæredygtighed: de 3 dimensioner bestående af miljø, sociale aspekter og økonomi introduceres og operationaliseres inden for transportområdet. Der redegøres for hvad bæredygtige transportløsninger er, og hvordan den danske planlægningsproces kan udvikle sig i en mere bæredygtig retning.Cost-benefit analyse (CBA): Gennemgang af relevante koncepter og begreber såsom nettonutidsværdi, nettogevinst pr. offentlig omkostningskrone, den interne rente, diskontering mv. Inddragelse af transportrelaterede effekter såsom rejsetidsbesparelser, anlægsomkostninger, vedligehold og drift, miljømæssige aspekter, mv. Analysemetoden vil tage udgangspunkt i regnearksmodellen, TERESA (Transportministeriets Regnearksmodel for Samfundsøkonomisk Analyse). Endelig lægges der særlig vægt på tilvejebringelse af passende og relevant input data samt nøgletal fra det seneste nøgletalskatalog for transportøkonomiske enhedspriser.Kvalitative analyser af de transporteffekter der ikke umiddelbart kan prissættes. Herunder tages udgangspunkt i VVM (Vurdering af Virkninger på Miljøet) redegørelser og deres anvendelse i planlægningsprocessen.

englishContents: The course is built on three pillars: strategic positioning, capabilities, and change. Starting from the analysis of the firm’s external competitive environment, we assess the “structural” attractiveness of the relevant industry and consider how a firm’s position in that industry affects its performance. Then shifting focus internally to an analysis of the firm’s resources and capabilities, we explore how competitive advantage is built and sustained. Finally, we turn to organizational change to explore what happens when a company’s environment changes and, in particular, how the organization’s behavioral context both facilitates and constrains our ability to put strategy into action.
danishContents: The course is built on three pillars: strategic positioning, capabilities, and change. Starting from the analysis of the firm’s external competitive environment, we assess the “structural” attractiveness of the relevant industry and consider how a firm’s position in that industry affects its performance. Then shifting focus internally to an analysis of the firm’s resources and capabilities, we explore how competitive advantage is built and sustained. Finally, we turn to organizational change to explore what happens when a company’s environment changes and, in particular, how the organization’s behavioral context both facilitates and constrains our ability to put strategy into action.

englishContents: Marketing and marketing Management in an overall business strategic context.Understanding and analysing the Market you are on (Market, Consumers, Segmentation, Differentiation and positioning). Developing marketing strategies (the 4 P’s - Product, Price, Place, Promotion). Analysing Business Markets: Organizational Buying Behaviour and Trends in PurchasingValue Creation and Value Innovation in Business MarketsRelationship Marketing and Managing Industrial NetworksDesigning & Managing Services; Creating and Delivering Total SolutionsValue Capturing in Business Markets
danishContents: Marketing and marketing Management in an overall business strategic context.Understanding and analysing the Market you are on (Market, Consumers, Segmentation, Differentiation and positioning). Developing marketing strategies (the 4 P’s - Product, Price, Place, Promotion). Analysing Business Markets: Organizational Buying Behaviour and Trends in PurchasingValue Creation and Value Innovation in Business MarketsRelationship Marketing and Managing Industrial NetworksDesigning & Managing Services; Creating and Delivering Total SolutionsValue Capturing in Business Markets

danishContents: Problem formulationConsutlancy strategyMethodData collectionData analysisRecommendations and implementation plan

englishContents: The course is built on three pillars: innovation leadership, innovation management, and topics in innovation. Innovation leadership sub-module takes place at UC Berkeley. The topics addressed within those 4 days are opportunity recognition, changing the rules, new trends in product development, and policy and innovation. Innovation management is taught at DTU and comprises topics like methods and frameworks in innovation management, idea generation, development of innovation, and open innovation. The last part of the module refers to various topics in innovation and it addresses the latest trends and challenges related to innovation.
danishContents: The course is built on three pillars: innovation leadership, innovation management, and topics in innovation. Innovation leadership sub-module takes place at UC Berkeley. The topics addressed within those 4 days are opportunity recognition, changing the rules, new trends in product development, and policy and innovation. Innovation management is taught at DTU and comprises topics like methods and frameworks in innovation management, idea generation, development of innovation, and open innovation. The last part of the module refers to various topics in innovation and it addresses the latest trends and challenges related to innovation.

englishContents: The course provides an intense introduction to micro and macro-economic analysis and its applications. The emphasis is on acquiring sound models and methods suitable for appraising decision-making issues and applicable in a wide variety of contexts. The microeconomics part of the course covers economic decision-making by individuals (households) and firms, the market forces of supply and demand, competition, business organization, and consumer behaviour. The macroeconomics part of the course covers topics in macroeconomics with emphasis on the determination of the aggregate level of economic activity and analysis of the macroeconomic effects of government policies. In addition to providing the elementary economic theory, this course also provides student with the essential knowledge for successful functioning in today's challenging economic times.The course introduces the essential elements of micro and macro-economic theory. Topics covered include consumer choice behavior, economic theory of the firm, cost models and production function, demand and supply in competitive markets, long-run economic growth, aggregate demand and supply, inflation and monetary policy, and stabilization policy.
danishContents: The course provides an intense introduction to micro and macro-economic analysis and its applications. The emphasis is on acquiring sound models and methods suitable for appraising decision-making issues and applicable in a wide variety of contexts. The microeconomics part of the course covers economic decision-making by individuals (households) and firms, the market forces of supply and demand, competition, business organization, and consumer behaviour. The macroeconomics part of the course covers topics in macroeconomics with emphasis on the determination of the aggregate level of economic activity and analysis of the macroeconomic effects of government policies. In addition to providing the elementary economic theory, this course also provides student with the essential knowledge for successful functioning in today's challenging economic times.The course introduces the essential elements of micro and macro-economic theory. Topics covered include consumer choice behavior, economic theory of the firm, cost models and production function, demand and supply in competitive markets, long-run economic growth, aggregate demand and supply, inflation and monetary policy, and stabilization policy.

Innovation management is taught at DTU and comprises topics like methods and frameworks in innovation management, idea generation, development of innovation, and open innovation. englishContents: Introduction to accounting and financial statements.Macro economic trendsFinancial analysis and key ratios.Cash flows and introduction to project evaluation.Foundations of value.Core valuation techniques.Advanced company valuation.
danishContents: Introduction to accounting and financial statements.Macro economic trendsFinancial analysis and key ratios.Cash flows and introduction to project evaluation.Foundations of value.Core valuation techniques.Advanced company valuation.

englishContents: In addtition to executing consultancy project, participants are given lectures in strategic problem solving. The course is based on the frameworks and tools that are employed in most strategy and management consulting companies. These include:•	issue driven problem structuring and hypothesis led problem solving •	the ‘pyramid principle’ for structuring communication.
danishContents: In addtition to executing consultancy project, participants are given lectures in strategic problem solving. The course is based on the frameworks and tools that are employed in most strategy and management consulting companies. These include:•	issue driven problem structuring and hypothesis led problem solving •	the ‘pyramid principle’ for structuring communication.

danishContents: Mass Media and Corporate CommunicationCreating a Strategic Communication PlanTransmedia brandingCorporate and personal communicationMedia handlingHigh-impact business presentationTraining and branding at executive level

englishContents: This course will introduce the culture based challenges in doing business in a developing country and approaches to investigate and understand innovation in a developed and developing country context. Against this background the course will discuss the specific challenges and opportunities of transfer of technologies, local innovation and adaptation of technologies in a developing country context. In this regard the participant will be introduced to the literature on global value chains, technology innovation systems, clusters of innovation, innovation for bottom of the pyramid, etc. The theoretical approaches introduced in the course will be illustrated by examples of innovation and technology development in developing countries based on the teacher's own interventions and research in Africa, China and South East Africa.
danishContents: This course will introduce the culture based challenges in doing business in a developing country and approaches to investigate and understand innovation in a developed and developing country context. Against this background the course will discuss the specific challenges and opportunities of transfer of technologies, local innovation and adaptation of technologies in a developing country context. In this regard the participant will be introduced to the literature on global value chains, technology innovation systems, clusters of innovation, innovation for bottom of the pyramid, etc. The theoretical approaches introduced in the course will be illustrated by examples of innovation and technology development in developing countries based on the teacher's own interventions and research in Africa, China and South East Africa.

englishContents: Sustainability challenges affect all parts of society all over the planet. Sustainability is easy to grasp as a goal but complex to deal with in concrete decision-making. Business, government and civil society have to collaborate and form multi-stakeholder partnerships in order to address them – while applying a holistic perspective. This implies an increasing need for managers, public officials and employees who can address sustainability matters on an informed basis when leading or being part of multidisciplinary teams. The course is seeking to fill this gap by providing participants with frameworks and tools that can help them create value, build business opportunity and adjust corporate strategy to address sustainability challenges. The course will be held by DTU faculty. The format is short lectures followed by group work and reflection rounds in plenum. Participants are encouraged to share experience and practice from their own organisations.

Business, government and civil society have to collaborate and form multi-stakeholder partnerships in order to address them – while applying a holistic perspective. The course will be held by DTU faculty. The format is short lectures followed by group work and reflection rounds in plenum. Participants are encouraged to share experience and practice from their own organisations.

englishContents: Digital and technological disruption is at the core in setting the direction of corporate strategic agendas within all industrial sectors today. In the midst of a massive transition, technology and data analytics are challenging the strategy and practices of every organization. Private companies and public institutions alike are challenged by the fact that data is “the new oil.” Participants will work with the ‘four mindsets framework’ and V9 model, defining and assessing relevant big data ‘building blocks’ of their businesses and crafting decision-making. Based on an online test they identify their dominant managerial mindset and relate the results to their strategy, market interaction and prioritization of organizational resources and capabilities. During the course, the participants collaborate to identify and overcome existing cognitive and cultural barriers to a customer-focused Big Data strategy as well as spotting new routes for business transformation and strengthened competitiveness

Private companies and public institutions alike are challenged by the fact that data is “the new oil.” Participants will work with the ‘four mindsets framework’ and V9 model, defining and assessing relevant big data ‘building blocks’ of their businesses and crafting decision-making. Based on an online test they identify their dominant managerial mindset and relate the results to their strategy, market interaction and prioritization of organizational resources and capabilities. During the course, the participants collaborate to identify and overcome existing cognitive and cultural barriers to a customer-focused Big Data strategy as well as spotting new routes for business transformation and strengthened competitiveness

englishContents: “Artificial Intelligence (AI) is the science and engineering of making intelligent machines, in particular intelligent computer programs.” This definition of artificial intelligence by John McCarthy, the father of the area, is still valid today, 60 years after it was formulated. Nevertheless, the area is much harder to define and delimit than most other areas of science and engineering, since intelligence is many different things, e.g. social, linguistic or emotional intelligence, and at very different levels. Correspondingly, AI is many very distinct techniques to mimic different aspects of human intelligence, and at very different levels. This makes it difficult to navigate in the area of AI and understand exactly what it can and cannot do. One of the goals of the course is to clarify the different paradigms, methods and subareas of AI, to provide a clear picture of what AI is, to make it easier to understand the current developments in the area, and to understand the possibilities and limitations of AI methods in general. AI is about mimicking the most essential abilities of humans, our cognitive abilities: perceiving, reasoning, planning, communicating, learning, etc. Hence AI has the potential of transforming our lives, society and businesses in a much more fundamental way than any other technology. Underlying and unifying the different methods in AI is usually the goal of making machines do what hitherto only humans have been able to, e.g. play chess, recognise faces, engage in a dialogue, drive a car or do medical diagnosis. The main source of inspiration for building AI systems that can solve these problems is human problem-solving. In some cases, AI systems are based on a very direct attempt to simulate the fundamental neurological processes of the human brain. In other cases, they are based on more abstract models of human reasoning and problem solving. However, it is important to understand that there still is – and probably always will be – fundamental differences between human and machine intelligence. These fundamental differences are essential to grasp in order to understand where AI techniques can succesfully be employed, what kind of human tasks can be replaced or enhanced by the use of AI, and how AI is going to affect the future job marked. These aspects will all be thoroughly covered in the course.The course will address both the benefits and the potential negative consequences, including discussions of the legal, ethical and philosophical aspects of AI.

englishContents: Servitization is a change in business strategy from product focus to service focus. This includes the combination of offerings by integrating product-based offerings with services, often to integrated Product-Service Systems. A servitization strategy affects all aspects of an organisation and its implementation into organisational routines is not trivial. In this course, we investigate different business models of servitizatinon and their relevance to specific industrial settings. Furthermore, we investigate how to implement a servitization strategy and what main pitfalls exist in this process. Finally, we show how the external relationships between a servitized company and its immediate partners such as customers and suppliers change when embarking on a servitization journey.
danishContents: Servitization is a change in business strategy from product focus to service focus. This includes the combination of offerings by integrating product-based offerings with services, often to integrated Product-Service Systems. A servitization strategy affects all aspects of an organisation and its implementation into organisational routines is not trivial. Finally, we show how the external relationships between a servitized company and its immediate partners such as customers and suppliers change when embarking on a servitization journey.
