englishContents: The 1st and the 2nd laws of thermodynamics. A more thorough introduction to the concept of entropy than what is normally seen at introductory courses on thermodynamics. Assessment of popular descriptions of entropy as disorder, scattering, information and the arrow of time. Exergy as a measure of energy quality. Exergy consumption in physical processes. Exergy consumption in chemical processes. Exergy analysis of selected systems such as cooling machines, engines, fuel cells, chemical industry, electricity production.
danishContents: Termodynamikkens 1. og 2. lov. En grundigere introduktion til begrebet entropi end man normalt ser på indledende kurser i termodynamik. Vurdering af populærbeskrivelser af entropi som uorden, spredning, information, frihed og tidens pil. Exergi som mål for energikvalitet. Exergiforbrug ved fysiske processer. Exergiforbrug ved kemiske processer. Exergianalyse af udvalgte systemer som f.eks. kølemaskiner, motorer, brændselsceller, kemisk industri, elproduktion.

englishContents: The course is divided in four modules with the following themes.1. Organic chemistry and materials (covalent bonding, structure-properties relationships, polymers)2. Physical and electrochemistry (laws of gases, phase diagrams, thermodynamics, thermochemistry, redox and electrochemistry 3. Surface, catalysis and fuel chemistry (surfaces and interfaces, heterogeneous catalysis, fuel chemistry)4. Inorganic materials (forms of carbon, metals, alloys, ceramics)
danishContents: Kurset er opdelt i fire moduler med følgende temaer:1. Organisk kemi og materialer (kovalent binding, strukturegenskabsforhold, polymerer)2. Fysisk- og elektrokemi (gasser, fasediagrammer, termodynamik, termokemi, redox og elektrokemi)3. Overflade, katalyse og brændstofkemi (overflader og grænseflader, heterogen katalyse, brændstofkemi)4. Uorganiske materialer (kulstoffer, metaller,  legeringer, keramik)

englishContents: The course focus is on the description of material properties of crystalline inorganic solids. The description of crystal structures, the concept of point defects as well as defect chemistry will be thoroughly presented to be able to utilize these concepts in describing the function of devices. Methods of classifying materials from their electronic structures are presented as are selected elements of thermodynamics important to describe coupling phenomena such as thermoelectricity and piezoelectricity. Examples of materials and preferred material models will be based on our research and development in the areas of fuel cells, advanced Li-ion batteries, solar cells, piezoelectric generators and thermoelectric generators. The form of the course will be lectures combined with problem solving. During the course, the students will work on their own small projects, aiming to design an “on paper” complete functional device belonging to one of the classes presented in the course (thermoelectric generators, Li-ion batteries, solid oxide fuel cells, solar cells and piezoelectric generators). The students will work individually or in groups on this. Supervision will be provided. The purpose of these projects is to work actively with the tools and descriptions presented in the lectures.
danishContents: Kursets fokus er på materialeegenskaber af faste krystallinske uorganiske materialer. Beskrivelsen af krystalstrukturer, punktdefekter og defektkemi gennemgås grundigt med henblik på at gøre den studerende i stand til at bruge disse begreber i beskrivelsen af funktionelle materialer og deres anvendelse i diverse energiteknologier. Metoder til at klassificere materialer ud fra deres elektronstruktur/ledningsevne beskrives og suppleres med elementer fra anvendt termodynamik, der er centrale for forståelsen af koblingsfænomener såsom termoelektrisk og piezoelektrisk effekt. Eksempler på materialer og foretrukne modelbeskrivelser vil tage udgangspunkt i vores forskning inden for brændselsceller, avancerede Li-ion-batterier, solceller, piezoelektriske generatorer og termoelektriske generatorer. Kurset vil bestå af forelæsninger såvel som opgaveløsning. Som en del af kurset vil de studerende arbejde med et eget projekt, der går på at designe, på papiret, en hel funktionel enhed inden for en af de adresserede anvendelser (termoelektriske generatorer, Li-ion-batterier, fastoxidbrændselsceller, solceller og piezoelektriske generatorer). De studerende vil arbejde enkeltvis eller i grupper og under supervision med dette. Formålet med dette projekt er at arbejde aktivt med de begreber og beskrivelser, der præsenteres i kurset.

englishContents: You will work with a postdoc/researcher/senior researcher/associate professor on experimental work in an ongoing research project in which the supervising postdoc/researcher/senior researcher/associate professor is involved. The specific topic for the course will depend on the ongoing projects in the department and will be related to one of key technologies that we are working with in DTU Energy. The technologies are (read more here: http://www.energy.dtu.dk/english/Research):• Fuel cells• Electrolysis• Batteries• Membranes for gas separation• Magnetic refrigeration• Thermoelectrical components• Flue gas purification• Superconductivity• PhotocatalysisShortly after the deadline for sign-up via the Studyplanner, you will be asked to send an overview of the courses you have taken during your study at DTU (or another university). We will hereafter match students with an appropriate supervisor and research project.
danishContents: Du kommer til at arbejde med en postdoc/forsker/seniorforsker/lektor med eksperimentelt arbejde i et igangværende forskningsprojekt, i hvilket din vejleder i 3-ugers perioden er involveret.Det specifikke emne for kurset/dit projekt vil afhænge af igangværende projekter i DTU Energi og vil ligge inden for en af de teknologier, som vi arbejder med i DTU Energi. Teknologierne er følgende (læs mere her: http://www.energy.dtu.dk/Forskning):• Brændselsceller• Elektrolyse• Batterier• Membraner til gasseparation• Magnetisk køling• Termoelektriske komponenter• Røggasrensning• Superledning• FotokatalyseKort efter fristen for tilmelding via studieplanlæggeren vil du blive bedt om at sende et liste over de kurser, du har taget i løbet af dit studium ved DTU (eller andet universitet). Vi vil herefter matche studerende med en passende vejleder og projekt.
englishTitle: Research immersion – Department of Energy Conversion and Storage

englishContents: An introduction to key concepts of superconductivity is given with a focus on critical parameters, magnetic penetration and quantization, type I and II superconductors (London and Ginzburg-Landau theory), magnetic flux pinning and loss mechanisms. Fabrication and characterization techniques are introduced in relation to relevant critical properties and technical system operation for various technologies ranging from fusion power to smart-grid transport cables. Thermo-mechanical and electromagnetic material and system constraints are specifically described from a superconducting wind turbine perspective.  The course also includes an introduction to a system energy evaluation methodology and subsequent critical assessment of the “cost of energy” between various types of present energy technologies.
danishContents: Kurset giver en introduktion til nøglebegreber for superledere med vægt på kritiske parametre, magnetiske effekter, herunder fluksindtrængning og -kvantisering, type I og II superledere (London og Ginzburg-Landau teorier), pinning af magnetisk fluks og tabsmekanismer. Fabrikations- og karakteriseringsteknikker gennemgås mht. kritiske parametre og drift af tekniske systemer som fusionskraftværker og "smart-grid" forsyningskabler. Superledende vindturbinegeneratorer gennemgås mht. termomekaniske og elektromagnetiske systemkrav. Kurset giver også en introduktion til evalueringsmetoder for energisystemer og anvendelse af energiomkostningsvurderinger ("cost-of-energy") for forskellige energiteknologier.

englishContents: An introduction to key concepts of superconductivity is given with focus on critical parameters. Project parts: project planning, literature study, conduct an experimental project, write a scientific article/report and project presentation technique. The experimental project content is chosen with a focus on either simulation or hands-on. The project report is constructed as a scientific article and the content is presented at the examination.
danishContents: Kurset giver en introduktion til nøglebegreber for superledere med vægt på kritiske parametre. Projektindhold: projektplanlægning, litteraturstudie, udføre et eksperimentelt projekt, videnskabelig artikel/rapportformulering og projektpræsentationsteknik. De eksperimentelle projekters indhold vælges med fokus på enten simulering eller hands-on. Rapporten udformes som en videnskabelig artikel, og denne præsenteres individuelt til eksamen.

englishContents: Vibrational spectroscopy, Raman spectroscopy, infrared spectroscopy, vibrational and electronic structure of materials, experimental design, ex situ/in situ/in operando, instrumentation, heterogeneous catalysis, fuel cells, electrolysis, batteries, energy materials, electrochemistry.
danishTitle: Eksperimentelt kursus i vibrationsspektroskopi på funktionelle materialer
danishContents: Vibrationsspektroskopi, Raman spektroskopi, infrarød spektroskopi, vibrations- og elektronisk struktur af materialer, forsøgsdesign, ex situ/in situ/in operando,  instrumentering, heterogen katalyse, brændselsceller, elektrolyse, batterier, energimaterialer, elektrokemi.
englishTitle: Experimental course in vibrational spectroscopy on functional materials

englishContents: The course will explain the basic principles of electricity storage and heat storage technologies and their role in the present and future sustainable energy system. An overview of the different storage methods will be given followed by studies of the different types in detail. Electrochemical energy storage using conventional batteries, flow batteries and electrolysers will be described in terms of thermodynamics, operating principles, efficiency, lifetime, energy density and storage duration. Other electrical storage technologies including pumped hydro, compressed air, flywheels and supercapacitors will be introduced and compared. Heat storage using hot water tanks and pits, phase-change materials, aquifers and stones will be similarly explained. Design criteria and examples of simulations and techno-economics calculations e.g. to determine feasible storage solutions for certain applications and scenarios will be given. Finally, new storage technologies and opportunities for storage will be discussed.
danishContents: Dette kursus vil forklare de grundlæggende principper for teknologier til lagring af elektricitet og varme og deres rolle i det nuværende og fremtidige bæredygtige energisystem. Der gives et overblik over forskellige lagringsmetoder efterfulgt af studier af udvalgte typer i større detalje. Elektrokemisk energilagring ved anvendelse af konventionelle batterier, flow-batterier og elektrolysatorer vil blive beskrevet i termodynamisk perspektiv, driftsprincipper, effektivitet, levetid, energitæthed og lagringsvarighed. Andre elektriske lagringsteknologier, herunder ”pumped hydro”, tryksat luft, svinghjul og superkapacitorer, vil blive introduceret og sammenlignet. Varmelagring ved anvendelse af varmtvandsbeholdere og gruber, faseændringsmaterialer, grundvandsmagasiner og sten vil også blive gennemgået. Designkriterier og eksempler på simuleringer og teknoøkonomiske udregninger fx for at kunne fastlægge mulige lagringsløsninger til specifikke anvendelser og scenarier vil blive gennemgået. Afslutningsvis vil nye lagringsteknologier og muligheder blive diskuteret.

englishContents: The magnetism of permanent (NdFeB) magnets and soft ferromagnets (Fe, Gd, Ni…) and their interaction. Specifying cost / objective functions for optimizing magnetostatic assemblies. Isotropic and anisotropic permeability tensor. The demagnetization tensor field and small homogeneously magnetized objects. Experimental realization of permanent magnet configurations of own design using simple magnets as building blocks.Introduction to programming or similar is a requirement, but it is emphasized that the focus of the course is on design and optimization - not on on hardcore programming.
danishTitle: Permanente magneter, deres brug og optimering
danishContents: Permanente magneter (fx NdFeB), deres magnetisme og interaktion med bløde ferromagneter (Fe, Gd, Ni...). At specificere objektfunktioner for optimeringsproblemer af magnetostatiske konfigurationer. Den isotrope og den anisotrope permeabilitetstensor. Demagnetiseringstensorfeltet og små homogent magnetiserede legemer. Eksperimentel realisering af permanente magnetkonfigurationer baseret på eget design og ved brug af simple magneter som byggeblokke.Indledende programmering eller lignende er en forudsætning, men det understreges, at fokus er på optimering og design - ikke på dybdegående programmering.
englishTitle: Permanent magnets, their use and optimization

englishContents: Fundamentals of low temperature fuel cells and electrolysers (mostly alkaline cells and PEM cells). Theoretical descriptions of the electrochemical and thermodynamical properties of fuel cells and electrolysers. Materials used for the components (electrolytes, catalysts, electrodes, bipolar plates, etc.) of the different cells. Materials properties, conduction mechanisms, requirements for the individual components. The assembled cells, stacks and system. Electrochemical characterization and evaluation of cell properties. Applications, system requirements, fuels processing, hydrogen storage and cell degradation mechanisms. Finally, the main development challenges and future trends will be outlined.
danishTitle: Ph.d.-kursus om introduktion til lavtemperaturbrændselsceller og elektrolysator
danishContents: Se engelsk tekst
englishTitle: Ph.D. course in introduction to low-temperature fuel cells and electrolyser

englishContents: Theoretical descriptions of the fundamental mechanisms and properties of lithium-ion, metal-sulfur and metal-air batteries, e.g. specific energies and over-voltages. Materials demands for the individual components, i.e. the electrolyte material, the anode material and the cathode material, as well as interface formation (SEI) between electrolyte and electrodes. Electrochemical characterization and evaluation of cell properties by electrochemical impedance spectroscopy methods. Description/studies of degradation mechanisms. Safety issues. Fabrication and cell assembly will be treated briefly.
danishContents: Se engelsk tekst
englishTitle: Ph.D. course in introduction to batteries

englishContents: Theoretical descriptions of the electrochemical and thermodynamical fundamental properties of ceramic-based fuel cells. Materials properties, conduction mechanisms, requirements for the individual components, i.e. the electrolyte material, the anode material and the cathode material, as well as challenges for the assembled cells. Electrochemical characterization and evaluation of cell properties by electrochemical impedance spectroscopy methods. Description/studies of degradation mechanisms for state-of-the-art SOFC and SOEC. Fabrication, cell and stack design and market opportunities will be treated briefly.
danishTitle: Ph.d.-kursus om introduktion til SOFC og SOEC
danishContents: Se engelsk tekst
englishTitle: Ph.D. course in introduction to SOFC and SOEC

englishContents: The course covers a wide range of subjects in the field of energy conversion and storage, including fuel cells, batteries, solar cells and caloric energy conversion. These topics are presented by a series of researchers who actively work on these topics. The purpose of the course is to ensure that the PhD students within the field of energy research are well-informed in all areas of energy conversion and storage, including areas they do not specialize in. The specific content of the course changes from semester to semester depending on the teachers and guests participating in the course, and depending on the interests of the participating students. Additionally, the course will contain presentations on innovation and patent issues, scientific communication, and proper scientific and ethical conduct. During the course, a student will give two presentations. One will be a short summary of his/her PhD project; the other will be on a topic within energy conversion and storage currently unknown to the student, chosen in agreement with the course responsibles. One of these presentations must be accompanied by a short (3 page) description of the technology. It is expected that the students prepare themselves for each of the presentations by reading background material. For the oral exam, a student will choose a number of the other students' presentations, one of which will be randomly chosen at the oral exam, where the student must then explain the main topics and ideas of the presentation. A scientific article within energy conversion and storage, given to the student in advance of the exam, must also be presented at the oral exam.
danishContents: Kurset dækker en bred vifte af emner inden for energikonvertering og -lagring, såsom brændselsceller, batterier, solceller og kalorisk energikonvertering. Disse emner præsenteres af forskere, som aktivt arbejder med emnerne til hverdag. Formålet med kurset er at sikre, at de ph.d.-studerende inden for energiforskning er velorienterede inden for alle områder af energikonvertering og -lagring, også de områder de ikke selv er specialiserede i. Det konkrete indhold af kurset veksler fra semester til semester afhængigt af lærerne og gæster, der deltager i kurset, og også afhængigt af de deltagende studerendes interesser.Derudover vil kurset indeholde oplæg om innovation og patentering, videnskabelig kommunikation og korrekt videnskabelig og etisk adfærd.I løbet af kurset skal den studerende give to præsentationer. Den ene skal være en kort præsentation af ph.d.-projektet, mens den anden skal være i et for den studerende ukendt emne inden for energikonvertering of -lagring, valgt i samarbejde med de kursusansvarlige. En af disse præsentationer skal underbygges med en kort (3 sider) beskrivelse af teknologien. Det forventes, at de studerende forbereder sig på de enkelte præsentationer ved at læse baggrundsmateriale.Til den mundtlige eksamen vælger den studerende et antal af de andre studerendes præsentationer, hvoraf én trækkes tilfældigt til eksamen. Den studerende skal så kunne redegøre for dette emne. En videnskabelig artikel inden for energikonvertering og -lagring, som den studerende får udleveret et par dage før den mundtlige eksamen, skal også præsenteres ved den mundtlige eksamen.
englishTitle: Ph.D. course in modern energy research

englishContents: The course covers: Advanced kinetics, Marcus theory, transport mechanism(s) in liquids and solids, using porous electrodes and electro crystallisation. For electrochemical impedance spectroscopy (EIS) the following topics are covered: Basic concepts of conductivity, dielectric constant, impedance, admittance and their application in impedance spectroscopy. Data analysis of EIS using graphical analysis by Nyquist, Bode, Difference, Analysis of Difference in Impedance spectra (ADIS) and Distribution of Relaxation Times (DRT) plots, as well as quantitative impedance analysis via equivalent circuit models of electrochemical systems, non-linear least squares fitting. Also covered is design of electrochemical experiments, optimization of cell design, electrochemical hardware, electrode selection and reference electrode design.The course includes practical as well as theoretical exercises that serve to illustrate some of the electrochemical concepts.
danishContents: See English description

englishContents: Introduction to computational modelling (classical force fields, electronic structure, molecular dynamics).Density Functional Theory (fundamentals, exchange-correlation functionals, many-body methods, limitations).What can we calculate with DFT? DFT codes and interfaces.Introduction to Linux machines, scripting, ASE and GPAW.ASE/GPAW exercises (molecules, bulks, slabs).Structural, electronic, and optical properties of materials for energy applications (theory and exercises).High-throughput screening approaches and databases (examples and exercises).Machine learning and genetic algorithms (examples and exercises).Project (machine learning on a given set of data, DFT calculations on selected materials)Weekly live chat with teachers and teaching assistants for efficient feedback, discussion, and alignment of expectations.Forum for Q&A.
danishTitle: Ph.d.-kursus om computermodellering af materialer til energiapplikationer
danishContents: See English text
englishTitle: PhD course in computational modelling of materials for energy applications

englishContents: Only Danish version
danishContents: Kursusindhold Kurset baserer sig på grundlæggende elementer af biokemi, biofysik, celle og molekylærbiologi samt generel histologi med det formål at give en grundlæggende forståelse af cellers struktur og funktion samt organisering af celler i væv. Forelæsninger: Cellens struktur og funktion belyst ved mikroskopiske teknikker. Immunhistologiske principper. Opbygning og funktion af membraner, organeller, og cytoskelet i relation til processer som proteinsyntese, sekretion, cellemigration, og vesikel/organel transport.Syntese, modifikation og nedbrydning af proteiner. Vesikulær og ikke-vesikulær sortering af proteiner gennem konsensus signaler og sorteringsreceptorer. Membranproteiner herunder transportproteiner og signaleringsreceptorer. Struktur af DNA og RNA, replikation af DNA, transkription af DNA.Det centrale dogme (fra DNA til protein). Opbygning og funktion af gener, samt regulering af genexpression. Genteknologiske metoder inkl. kloning, polymerase chain reaction (PCR), hybridisering, samt proteinelektroforese.Stoftransport gennem cellemembranen. Det molekylære grundlag for membrankonduktanser og membranpotentialet. Excitabilitet. Synaptisk transmission.Generel opbygning af væv (stroma/parenkym/de fire store vævsklasser). Den molekylære sammensætning og funktion af ekstracellulær matrix. Struktur og organisering af muskelvæv, bindevæv, brusk og knogle, samt perifere nerver. Inflammation.Øvelser:Stoftransport over biologiske membraner.Nerveimpuls og udbredelse af aktionspotentiale.Biomolekyler og måling af enzymaktivitet.Mikroskopiske demonstrationstimer.Holdundervisning:Grupperegning i biofysik.Problemløsning i biokemi.Case stories: i) mekaniske proteser og knogler, og ii) muskel- og nerveaktivitet.

englishContents: The focus of the course is the study of disease, including the cause (etiology), mechanisms of development (pathogenesis), and structural/functional alterations involved. The course covers the pathologic basis of a broad range of common diseases, including the normal histology of relevant tissues and organs required to identify pathological lesions. Main topics include cell injury, adaptation, and death; inflammation; neoplasia; and cardiovascular, immunological, infectious, neurological, metabolic, and musculoskeletal diseases. There is a focus on definitions, terminology, and the description of morphological changes in cells and tissues, as illustrated by clinical examples. There is a strong emphasis on current pathophysiological theories and molecular disease mechanisms, which will be covered by lectures and critically discussed during student activating lessons.
danishContents: Se engelsk version

englishContents: Lectures covering PK-PD relationships, as well as distribution, metabolite kinetics, effect at receptor and ionchannel level, effect measurement, dose-effect relationships, population methods, simulation of PK-PD relationships and variability in PK-PD response and dosing to different patient populations.Computer sessions for pharmacokinetic pharmacodynamic modeling using the program Phoenix WinNonlin, Berkeley Madonna and Microsoft Excel.

englishContents: •	Strategic analysis (SWOT, PEST, Porters Five Forces, Porters Value Chain, Porters        Generic Strategies and the Boston model)•	Cost theory•	Optimal price and sale under different forms of competition•	Bookkeeping•	Annual Accounts and its components•	Financial Analysis•	Budgeting as a management tool•	Budgeting•	Investment•	Finance•	Introduction to valuation of companies based on multipliers such Price/Earning and        Price/Equity etc.
danishContents: •	Strategiske analyser (PESTEL, Porters 5 Forces, Porters værdikæde, Porters generiske        strategier, Boston modellen, PLC, SWOT)•	Omkostningsteori•	Optimering af pris og afsætning under forskellige konkurrenceformer.•	Virksomhedens registreringssystem (bogføring)•	Årsregnskabet og dets bestanddele•	Regnskabsanalyse•	Budgettet som ledelses- og styringsværktøj•	Budgettering•	Omkostningsteori•	Investering•	Finansiering•	Introduktion til værdiansættelse af virksomheder (relativ værdiansættelse baseret på        multipler som Price/Earning, Kurs/Indre værdi m.v.)

englishContents: The student works independently and under guidance with Innovation processes, basic innovation methods and facilitating of the creative and relational processes of others in theory and practice
danishContents: Den studerende arbejder selvstændigt med Innovationsprocesser, grundlæggende innovationsmetoder og med facilitering af andres kreative og relationelle processer i teori og praksis

englishContents: Product development processes and sub processes. Theoretical and practical workshop classes
danishContents: Produktudviklingsprocesser og tilhørende delprocesser. Teoretisk og praktisk værkstedsarbejde
englishTitle: Product development - The stages and processes of product development

englishContents: •	The CES program, structure and use. The program will be installed on the student's computer (License paid by DTU)•	Introduction to the subjects stress and strain as well as the analysis of a strain tension graph•	Measurement of mechanical material parameters such as stress, strain, hardness, impact strength and fatigue (Wöhler curve)•	Measurement of chemical composition of materials from spectroscopy / X-ray analysis and IR spectroscopy and other test methods•	Introduction to the atomic structure of materials, crystallographic and amorphous structures.•	Introduction and use of phase diagrams.•	Introduction to the subject of corrosion with emphasis on corrosion of metals in humid / dry environments.•	Introduction to various corrosion protection methods and selection of the best method under given circumstances.•	The structure of Metals and their applications and properties.•	The structure of Polymers and their applications and properties.• The structure of Ceramics and their applications and properties.• The structure of Composites and their applications and properties.• Analysis of the materials in a given component and suggestions for selecting materials to a component.
danishContents: •	Programmet CES, opbygning og benyttelse. Programmet installeres på de studerendes computer (Licens betalt af DTU)•	Introduktion til emnerne spænding og tøjning samt analyse af en spændings-tøjningsgraf•	Måling af mekaniske materialeparametre som spænding, tøjning, hårdhed, slagsejhed og udmattelse (Wöhlerkurve)•	Måling af materialers kemiske sammensætning ud fra spektroskopi/røntgenanalyse og IR spektroskopi og andre testmetoder•	Introduktion til materialers atomare opbygning, krystallografiske og amorfe strukturer.•	Introduktion og brug af fasediagrammer.•	Introduktion til emnet korrosion med hovedvægt på korrosion af metaller i fugtige/ tørre omgivelser.•	Introduktion til forskellige korrosionsbeskyttende foranstaltninger samt valg af den bedste metode under givne omstændigheder.•	Metallers opbygning, anvendelser og egenskaber•	Polymerers opbygning, anvendelser og egenskaber•	Keramers opbygning, anvendelser og egenskaber•	Kompositmaterialers opbygning, anvendelser og egenskaber•	Analyse af materialerne i en given komponent samt forslag til valg af disse.

englishContents: The main content of the course is, as a starting point, the basic concepts in the problem-based task solving and scientific work method. In addition, there are other elements such as project planning and data processing, visual communication forms and presentation of own work and competences.
danishContents: Kursets hovedindhold er som udgangspunkt grundbegreberne i den problembaserede opgaveløsning og videnskabelige arbejdsmetode. Dertil kommer andre elementer som projektplanlægning og databehandling, visuelle kommunikationsformer og præsentation af eget arbejde og kompetence.

englishContents: Develop a sustainable idea into a business opportunity and argue for sustainability. Write an action-oriented business plan and in the process use entrepreneurial methods such as effectual entrepreneurship, lean startup, customer development, and the business model canvas.It is an integral part of the course that the student together with his/her group write an abstract and participates in Green Challenge.
danishContents: Udvikle en bæredygtig ide til en forretningsmulighed og argumentere for ideens bæredygtighed. Skrive en handlingsorienteret forretningsplan og i processen anvende entreprenante metoder herunder: effectual entrepreneurship, lean startup, customer development og business model canvas.Det er obligatorisk at den studerende, sammen med sin gruppe, skriver et abstrakt baseret på den bæredygtige forretnings ide og deltager i Grøn Dyst.

englishContents: The objective of the course is to introduce the students to Human-Centered Innovation/Design. User research and -tests are a central theme.We will also be discussing processes and how focus on the process can improve the final result.The cource also gives an introduction to study techniques, academic writing and arguments.Central for the course is a Design Thinking group project through which the students find a user need or a problem to create a simple prototype of a solution for.The students have to learn to do qualitative observations and interviews, and they have to analyse and turn findings into concept ideas.The concept and prototype is then developed through an iterative proces, alternating between  Development and user tests. It requires the students to learn to make quick sketches and obtain early user feedback.In the last part of the semester, when the final concept is done, the students will be introduced to a number of concepts and positions of ethics that they have to apply in a reflection on their solution.The student will be required to read a fair amount of relevant texts that they have to use in their reports The exam will consist of a number of reports written during the course that must be defended in  an oral exam.
danishContents: Formålet med kurset er at introducere de studerende til Human-Centered innovation/design. Derfor er brugerresearch og –tests, samt brugerforståelse generelt et centralt tema.Vi vil også diskutere processer, og hvordan fokus på processen kan forbedre det endelige resultat.Endelig giver kurset også en introduktion til studieteknik, samt opgaveskrivning og akademisk argumentation. Omdrejningspunktet for kurset er et gruppeprojekt, hvor de studerende  - via en Design Thinking-proces - skal finde et brugerbehov eller en problemstilling på baggrund af hvilken, de skal udvikle et koncept og en enkel prototype.De studerende skal lære at lave kvalitative (deltager)observationer og interviews, og de skal analysere og omsætte findings til konceptidéer. Koncept og prototype udvikles gennem en interativ proces, hvor de studerende skiftevis udvikler og brugertester. Det indebærer bl.a., at de studerende skal lære at udarbejde hurtige skitser og få tidlig brugerfeedback.I slutningen af semestret, når det endelige koncept ligger færdigt, skal de studerende gennemføre et etikmodul, hvor de skal lære en række klassiske etiske begreber og positioner, som de skal anvende i en refleksion over deres koncept.  Der vil være en del læsestof undervejs som det forventes, at de studerende læser og anvender i delrapporterne.Eksamen består af en række delrapporter, der udarbejdes i grupper i løbet af semestret og forsvares ved en mundtlig eksamen. Der er ekstern censur.

englishContents: The goal of the course is to introduce the students to Interaction Design. The students must submit a report with a clear argument for the chosen solution and aaplication of the curriculum.The course is a continuation of the course Design, Users & Ethics (62018) and it is expected that the students use and apply theory and methods from this course where relevant.The exam is submission of a project report (group), a team reflection report, a Group presentation and an individual oral exam.Important: A number of mandatory assignments will be posed to the students during the course. The students have to hand in on time and pass all of them in order to be allowed to participate in the exam. The assignments can take the form of written text, oral tests, presentations and/or multiple choice tests.
danishContents: Formålet med kurset er at introducere de studerende til interaktionsdesign.Kurset omhandler bl.a. design patterns og -principper, usability, brugertests. Der skal afleveres en rapport med en klar argumentation, hvor pensumlitteraturen anvendes.Kurset bygger videre på kurset Design, brugere & etik (62018), og det forventes, at teori og metode fra dette kursus anvendes hvor det er relevant. Eksamen består af aflevering af projektrapport (gruppe), en refleksionsrapport, en gruppepræsentation samt individuel mundtlig eksamen.Vigtigt: Der vil være et antal obligatoriske opgaver, som den studerende skal bestå for at kunne gå til eksamen. Opgaverne kan være skriftlige opgaver, mundtlige prøver, præsentationer og/eller multiple choice tests.Det er en betingelse for deltagelse i gruppeprojekt og eksamen, at ALLE opgaver gennemføres rettidigt.

englishContents: The students will learn fundamental electronics; how to connect and programme a micro controller, construct simple circuits, for example, in order to create simple stand-alone interactive installations - with a focus on how they can support and motivate interaction between people and computational devices.This will provide the students with skills to prototype using new interactive technologies and development environments.
danishContents: De studerende kommer til at lære fundamental elektronik; hvordan man tilslutter og programmerer en mikrocontroller, konstruerer simple kredsløb, mm. for at kunne skabe simple stand-alone interaktive installationer – med et fokus på, hvordan de kan understøtte og motivere interaktion mellem mennesker og computational devices.Dette vil give den studerende færdigheder til at prototype med nye interaktive teknologier og udviklingsmiljøer.

englishContents: Topics:- Qualitative user research- Customer journeys- Service ecology mapping and analysis- Touch point analysis and design - Front and backstage processing- Development and interpretation  of service blueprints- UX and usability- User tests- Service business modelsParticipant will be working in teams in - and outside of - class
danishContents: Emner i kurset:- Kvalitativ brugerresearch- Customer journeys- Service ecology mapping og analyse- Touch point analyse og design- Front-and backstage processing- Udvikling og fortolkning af service blueprints- UX, usability - Brugertests- Service forretningsmodellerTeamsamarbejde er centralt, og deltagere skal forvente at skulle mødes med teamet uden for undervisningen.

englishContents: The students must work out a speculative concept and an interactive prototype involving several different types of interaction and interfaces and creates an experience for the user/audience.Validation of the concept/prototype happens via different kinds of user involvement; research, tests and/or experiments.The concept and prototype are expected to be based on thorough research, but all of the work involved in the development and validation can in itself be seen as research where a topic is explored.Students taking this course must be prepared to be challenged on their creativity. Speculative design explores a question or topic in a creative way - it doesn't necessarily focus on marketable solutions.
danishContents: De studerende skal udarbejde et spekulativt koncept og en interaktiv prototype, der inddrager flere  forskellige typer af interaktion og interfaces og skaber en ’experience’ hos brugeren/beskueren. Validering af konceptet/prototypen sker ved forskellige relevante former for brugerinvolvering; research, tests og/eller eksperimenter.Konceptet og prototypen forventes at være baseret på et grundigt researcharbejde, men hele arbejdet med udarbejdelsen og valideringen kan i sig selv ses som værende et stykke research, hvor et emne undersøges og udforskes.Studerende, der vælger kurset skal være forberedt på at blive udfordret på kreativiteten. Spekulativt design lægger op til en kreativ udforskning af et spørgsmål eller et emne - og har ikke nødvendigvis fokus på at skabe en løsning, der kan sælges på et marked.

englishContents: Product development, basic statics and strength of materials, design strategies,  CNC, specification, concept generation, prototyping, Sketchup
danishContents: Produktudvikling, grundlæggende statik og styrkelære, designstrategier, CNC, specifikation, konceptgenerering, prototypefremstilling, Sketchup

Speculative design explores a question or topic in a creative way - it doesn't necessarily focus on marketable solutions.

englishContents: Project tools:•	Project types and project phases•	Project objectives •	Stakeholder analysis, principles and methods •	Milestone plan and critical path, principles and methods •	Risk assessment•	Financial planning and estimation Project leadership:•	Personal profile•	Team development•	Presentation techniqueThe workform are in groups. Each group has to complete a project report and each student has to elaborate a individual process report which form part in the complete assessment.The course is structured with study specific adjustment and exam assignment.
danishContents: Projektværktøjer:•	Projekttyper og projektfaser•	Projektets målsætning •	Interessentanalyse, principper og metoder •	Milepæle og kritiske veje, principper og metoder •	Risikovurdering•	Økonomisk planlægning og estimering Projektledelse:•	Personprofil•	Teamudvikling•	PræsentationsteknikDer arbejdes i grupper, hvor der udarbejdes en samlet projektrapport, og den enkelte studerende udarbejder endvidere en individuel procesrapport, der indgår i den samlede bedømmelse.Kurset er struktureret med retningsspecifik tilpasning samt eksamensopgave.
englishTitle: Project Management - Tools and practical management

englishContents: • Production planning (MPS, MRP, PAC, and capacity planning)• Forecasting• Introduction to purchasing• Project planning (Gantt diagrams and time estimations) • Inventory control• Physical distribution and warehouse management• Short introduction to Lean manufacturing and quality management

englishContents: Simple mechanical, structural, thermodynamic and electrical engineering calculations. Being able to relate, apply and evaluate these in relation to industrial processes.
danishContents: Simple mekaniske, statiske, termodynamiske og elektrotekniske beregninger. At kunne relatere, anvende og vurdere disse i forhold til industrielle processer.

englishContents: Project theme Courses: Making a stirling engine in the workshop. Resolve business relevant tasks in e.g. mechanics, statics, strength of materials, thermodynamics. Technical view and tolerances, manufacturing technology, parts lists and process maps, Excel and systematic information. Project implementation Competencies
danishContents: Projekttemakurser: Fremstille en stirling motor i værkstedet. Løse virksomhedsrelevante opgaver indenfor f. eks. mekanik, statik, styrkelære, termodynamik. Teknisk afbildning og tolerancer, fremstillingsteknologi, styklister og procesoversigter, Excel samt systematisk informationssøgning. Projektgennemførelseskompetencer.

englishContents: The project will develop the skills of project 1The interdisciplinary project on the 2nd semester production processes as the overall theme. The project consists of:• Production Maturation of a product• Construction of a production system incl.management systems for a specified production.• Introduction to a business descriptionof the production system.In addition to project work held a number of thematic courses in the disciplines of management, environment, simulation and project implementation. These thematic courses are designed so that they support the project work.
danishContents: Projektet videreudvikler kompetencer fra projekt 1.Det tværfaglige projekt på 2. semester har produktionsprocesser som overordnet tema. Projektet består af:• Produktionsmodning af et produkt• Opbygning af et produktionssystem incl. styringssystemer, for en nærmere specificeret produktion.• Introduktion til en forretningsmæssig beskrivelseaf produktionssystemet.I tilknytning til projektarbejdet afholdes en række temakurser inden for fagområderne management, miljø, simulering og projektgennemførelse. Disse temakurser er udformet således, at de understøtter projektarbejdet.

englishContents: The basic manufacturing processes within machining (cutting, turning etc) and within non-cutting machining (bending, punching etc) are introduced. For the individual processes, the necessary data is determined. These include power requirements /power, time spent, and all necessary prerequisites are determined. Based on production volume and type of material, the choice of tools is made for the manufacturing process. Through laboratory experiments, theories from the course books are tested, and technical reports are made. Examine a "new technology" and present it to the class (group).
danishContents: • De basale fremstillingsprocesser, indenfor spåntagning (dreje, fræse, o.s.v.) og indenfor spånløs bearbejdning (bukke, stanse, o.s.v.), gennemgås. • For de enkelte processer, bestemmes nødvendige data, for at udføre disse; data som ”kraftbehov/effekt”, tidsforbrug, o.s.v., bestemmes og alle nødvendige forudsætninger fastsættes. • Med baggrund i produktionsvolumen og materialetype, vælges egnet værktøj, til fremstillingsprocessen. • Ved laboratorieforsøg, efterprøves nogle teorier, fra lærebøgerne, og tekniske rapporter udformes. Undersøge en "ny teknologi" og fremlæg den for klassen (gruppearbejde).

englishContents: - Introduction to the financial statements of the company - Cost theory- Cost optimal production technology- Cost optimal production rate- Demand theory- Market structure and profit maximisation- Break-even anlysis- Cash flow projections and investment decisions- Interest rate and discounting theory
danishContents: • Introduktion til virksomhedens årsregnskab• Omkostningsteori• Omkostningsoptimalt valg af produktionsteknologi• Omkostningsoptimal produktionshastighed• Afsætningsteori• Optimeringsteori under forskellige markedsformer (pris/mængde)• Nulpunktsanalyse• Likviditetsprognoser og investeringskalkuler• Rentesregning

danishContents: Produktions- og lagerstyringsbegreber og ordrestørrelsesmodeller Historien bag LeanValue Stream Mapping – current og future stateVærdiskabende og ikke værdiskabende aktiviteterDe 8 spildformerLean principperLøbende forbedringer – KaizenLEAN værktøjerVisual managementToyota DNA5 WHY og rootcause analyse

englishContents: The course includes a review of the main legal requirements for annual reports. Financial analyses of profitability, earnings, capital adjustment and solidity will be prepared. Examples of alternative accounts: environmental and quality records are reviewed. Profitability, balance sheet and liquidity budgets are prepared. Budgetary control based on deviations between budgets and interim statements. In addition, budgetary control will be based on decomposition of the profit contribution by using standard costs.  The students will perform profitability analyses based on the principles of Activity Based Costing. Characteristics of different types of financing will be reviewed. Linear Programming will be used to optimization/production planning.
danishContents: Kurset omfatter en gennemgang af de væsentligste lovmæssige krav til opstilling af årsrapporten. Der udarbejdes regnskabsanalyser for rentabilitet, indtjeningsevne, kapitaltilpasning og soliditet. Eksempler på alternative regnskaber, som f.eks. miljøregnskaber gennemgås. For så vidt angår budgettering udarbejdes der resultat-, likviditets- og balancebudgetter, ligesom der foretages budgetkontrol baseret på afvigelser i mellem budgetter og internt perioderegnskab. Derudover arbejdes der med budgetkontrol gennem dekomponering af dækningsbidragsafvigelsen ved anvendelse af standardomkostninger. Karakteristika ved forskellige finansieringsformer gennemgås. Lineær Programmering anvendes til optimering/produktionsplanlægning.
englishTitle: Managerial Economics and Basic Accounts Analysis

englishContents: Organisations formal features, including organization structure, objectives and how they can be designed for the most effective achievement of objectives and the informal features, including organizational culture and informal power structures. In addition, the course focuses particularly on the organization of corporate operations-/​production environment, so that students acquire specific skills to structure the production role within the company and change management
danishContents: Organisation og ledelseOrganisationers formelle træk, herunder organisationers struktur, mål og hvorledes de kan designes til den mest effektive målopfyldelse, samt de uformelle træk, herunder organisationskultur og uformelle magtstrukturer. Derudover fokuserer kurset særligt på organisering af virksomhedens drifts-/produktionsfunktioner, således at de studerende opnår en særlig kompetence i strukturering af produktionens rolle i virksomheden, samt forandringsledelse.

englishContents: The course includes theory and methodology for production engineers.- Introduction to relevant scientific theoretical basic concepts and models- Scientific argumentation technique and fundamental forms of reasoning- Generality, representativeness and forecasting ability of scientific knowledge- Introduction to methodology of natural sciences, humanities, social sciences and   technology. - Application of theory and techniques of problem identification and problem analysis- Quantitative analysis methods and techniques- Qualitative analysis methods, interviews, focus groups, observations, etc.- Selection of study design, including choice of data collection and   data processing methods- Existing operating technical concepts and analytical methods- Assessment of validity and realibilitet of studies and analysis- Special quantitative analysis (Frequency studies, Reliability, Multicriteria decision analysis,   Statistical analysis and Forecasts)
danishContents: Kurset indeholder videnskabsteori og metodelære for produktionsingeniører.- Introduktion til relevante videnskabsteoretiske grundbegreber og modeller- Videnskabelig argumentationsteknik og fundamentale begrundelsesformer - Videnskabelig videns generalitet, repræsentativitet og forudsigelseskrav- Introduktion til naturvidenskabelig, humanistisk, samfundsvidenskabelig og teknisk   metodologi- Anvendelse af teori og teknikker ved problemidentifikation og problemanalyse- Kvantitative analysemetoder og teknikker - Kvalitative analysemetoder, interviews, fokusgrupper, observationer mv.- Valg af undersøgelsesdesign, herunder valg af dataindsamlings- og  databehandlingsmetoder- Eksisterende driftstekniske koncepter og analysemetoder- Vurdering af validitet og realibilitet af undersøgelser og analyser- Særlige kvantitative analysemetoder (Frekvensanalyser, Pålidelighed, Multikriterie   beslutningsanalyser, statistiske analyser og Forecasts)
englishTitle: Scientific Theory and Manufacturing Engineering Methods

englishContents: The project om 4th semester will have production engineering improvement in a company as the overall theme. The project will include problem formulation, analysis and diagnosis and formulation of possible suggestions to solve the problems and possibly also ways to implement these suggestions. In the course, the students will also write and present one or more studies on a selected specific approved subject.It is important that the problems in the project are both complex and interdisciplinary. Analysis and solutions must include aspects from more than one discipline regarding Operations Management, Technology, Economy, and Information Technology. Operations Management aspects must always be included.
danishContents: Det tværfaglige projekt på 4. semester har forbedringer i virksomhedens produktions- og leverancesystem som det overordnede tema og der tages i størst muligt omfang udgangspunkt i aktuelle problemstillinger i en virksomhed. Projektet inkluderer en problemanalyse, afgrænsning og problemformulering, samt diverse faglige analyser, der leder til formuleringen af et eller flere forbedringsforslag. De forventede konsekvenser af fremsatte forslag skal vurderes, og der kan efter omstændighederne også indgå overvejelser vedrørende implementering eller elementer af egentlig implementering. I tilknytning til projektopgaven vil der blive stillet krav om udarbejdelse og præsentation af et eller flere teoretiske studier vedrørende et fagligt emne, der relaterer sig til den aktuelle problemstilling. Der lægges vægt på, at de problemstillinger, der arbejdes med i projektet er både komplekse og tværfaglige, således at løsninger forudsætter overvejelser og analyser, der inkluderer faglige aspekter inden for flere af områderne management, teknologi, økonomi og informationsteknologi. Management er her det mest centrale fagområde, der under alle omstændigheder bør være repræsenteret.

englishContents: 1. The function and organisation of court, including the influence from EU rules upon the national legislation with respect to what is legal, and how a case in practice will be settled in court. 2. Appointments, including the most important paragraphs in the law on appointments, the law on buying, the law on credits , the international law on buying and the transfer of ownership. From this, the student will be able to evaluate when a legal appointment is established, and what kind of legal aspects will be the result of not fulfilling such an appointment. 3. Claims and instruments of debts, securities, Surety and mortgage in real estate and movables. From this the student will learn how it is possible to finance a company today.  4. Compensation outside contracts and insurance contracts. The students will learn about the rules on compensation outside contracts and the different forms of insurance contracts. 5. Types of companies and handling of creditors. The most common types of companies wil be described and the differences. Also the rules for individual and universal persecution of creditors. 6. Employment law including the most important rules concerning emploument contracts. 7. Law on competition including restrictions and monopoly. 8. Marketing and the rules for good marketing practice. 9. Immaterial gods and the legal protection of certain types of immaterial gods.10. Comsumer protection
danishContents: 1. Domstolenes opbygning og funktion, herunder EU-rettens betydning for den nationale ret, med henblik på at udfinde, hvad der er gældende ret, og hvordan en retssag forløber i praksis.2. Aftaleret, herunder de vigtigste bestemmelser i aftaleloven, købeloven, kreditaftaleloven, den internationale købelov samt ejendomsrettens overgang, således at den studerende herved bliver i stand til at vurdere, hvornår der er indgået en gyldig bindende aftale samt hvilke retsvirkninger, der knytter sig til misligholdelse af en sådan aftale.3. Fordringer og gældsbreve, sikkerhed, kaution samt pant i fast ejendom og løsøre, således at den studerende herved bliver bekendt med, hvilke muligheder, der er for at finansiere en virksomhed i dag.4. Erstatning udenfor kontrakt og forsikringsaftaler, således at den studerende bliver indført i de erstatningsretlige regler uden for kontrakt og samtidig bliver gjort bekendt med de forskellige former for forsikringsaftaler.5. Virksomhedsformer og kreditorforfølgning med henblik på at gennemgå de mest almindelige virksomhedsformer og de forskelle der er. Endvidere at gennemgå reglerne for individuel forfølgning og universalforfølgning af krav.6. Ansættelsesret herunder de vigtigste regler vedrørende ansættelsesaftaler.7. Konkurrenceret herunder konkurrencebegrænsning og monopol.8. Markedsføring herunder reglerne for god markedsføringsskik.9. Immaterielle goder herunder den retlige beskyttelse af visse typer af immaterielle goder.10. Forbrugerbeskyttelse.

danishContents: - Supply chain og virksomhedens strategi og økonomi- Netværksdesign med kvantitative modeller- Supply chain koordinering ved flere aktører - Lagerstyring og produkt tilgængelighed- Transport i supply chain'en- Design af ny supply chain og beregning af omkostninger- Supply chain med genanvendelse- Indkøb og in-/outsourcing

englishContents: - Basic macroeconomic relationships between economic growth, employment, inflation, international competitiveness and balance of payments- Foreign exchange rates - including Denmark's fixed exchange-rate system- Interest rates and financial markets- Macro-economic forecasting models- Domestic and international macroeconomic forecasting- Economic policy in particular fiscal policy, monetary policy and policies for international competitiveness- International trade and globalization- Labour-market and developments in overall productivity- Current macroeconomic issues

englishContents: • Strategic accounts analysis• Activity Based Costing and Activity Based Management• Financial project control – Earned Value Project Management• Cost-benefit analysis• Shareholder value • Capital Asset Pricing Model• Enterprise Risk Management• Beyond Budgeting• Balanced Scorecards• Target Costing og Kaizen Costing• Lean Accounting• Benchmarking• Non financial reporting

englishContents: Sketching techniques, basic projection rules and standards for performing drawings of machine components. Dimensioning, including indication of simple tolerances and surface roughness. General introduction to graphic communication, including presentation of results in technical journals. Use of CAD for product modeling, production of technical drawings, illustrations and animations.Students will typically study delivered mechanical engineering products individually or in smaller groups and try to clarify a number of industrial, economic, quality, product development and technical aspects. The products are modeled descriptively and analytically in a variety of models, including describing and analyzing the features of the used machine elements. The work on product analysis is documented in the form of drawing documentation and journals.
danishContents: Skitseringsteknik, grundlæggende afbildningsregler og standarder for udførelse af tegninger af maskinkomponenter. Målsætning, herunder angivelse af simple tolerancer og overfladeruhed. Generel introduktion til grafisk kommunikation, herunder præsentation af resultater i tekniske journaler. Anvendelse af CAD til produktmodellering, fremstilling af tekniske tegninger samt illustrationer og animationer.De studerende vil typisk enkeltvist eller i mindre grupper studere udleverede maskintekniske produkter og prøve at belyse en række industrielle, økonomiske, kvalitetsmæssige, produktudviklingsmæssige og tekniske aspekter. Produkterne modelleres beskrivende og analytisk i en række modeller, herunder beskrives og analyseres anvendte maskinelementers funktioner. Arbejdet med produktanalyse dokumenteres i form af tegningsdokumentation og journaler.

englishContents: Experimental examination of mechanical product, eg. motor mower. Target analysis, including tolerances and surface roughness. Analysis of the kinematics of the leverbar mechanism and the internal combustion engine's mechanical work. Dimensioning of simple machine elements. Use of graphical communication, including presentation of results in the form of posters, slides and reports. Use of CAD for product modeling and manufacturing of technical drawings in connection with its own design project. Visit to major production companies.In groups of typical 4, students analyze a larger, mechanically-engineered product to try to illuminate a number of industrial, economic, quality, product development and technical aspects. The product is documented descriptively and analytically, including describes and analyzes the functions of the used machine elements. Function, design, manufacturing method and consequent production costs are sought. The work on product analysis is documented in the form of journals or minor reports.CDIO is an integral part of the course.
danishContents: Eksperimentel undersøgelse af mekanisk produkt, f.eks. motorplæneklipper. Analyse af målsætning, herunder benyttede tolerancer og overfladeruhed. Analyse af plejlstangsmekanismes kinematik og forbrændingsmotors udførte mekaniske arbejde. Dimensionering af simple maskinelementer. Anvendelse af grafisk kommunikation, herunder præsentation af resultater i form af posters, slides og rapporter. Anvendelse af CAD til produktmodellering og fremstilling af tekniske tegninger i forbindelse med eget konstruktionsprojekt. Besøg på større produktionsvirksomhed.I grupper på typisk 4 analyserer de studerende et større, udleveret maskinteknisk produkt for herved at prøve at belyse en række industrielle, økonomiske, kvalitetsmæssige, produktudviklingsmæssige og tekniske aspekter. Produktet dokumenteres beskrivende og analytisk, herunder beskrives og analyseres anvendte maskinelementers funktioner. Funktion, udformning, fremstillingsmetode og heraf følgende produktionsomkostninger søges klarlagt. Arbejdet med produktanalyse dokumenteres i form af journaler eller mindre rapporter.CDIO er en integreret del i kurset.

englishContents: The project work can be a theoretical or practical investigation of an engineering problem. It can also be made in cooperation with a company or a research institute, either in Denmark or abroad. Relevant technical topics and engineering methods shall be applied, and non-technical considerations and assessments may be included.
danishContents: Projektarbejdet kan være en teoretisk eller praktisk undersøgelse af et ingeniørmæssigt problem. Projektarbejdet kan udføres i samarbejde med et firma eller en forskningsenhed enten i Danmark eller i udlandet. Der skal benyttes relevante tekniske emner og engineering metoder, og brugen af ikke-tekniske overvejelser og vurderinger kan indgå i løsningen.

englishContents: The students work together in groups that are put together so that all students in the group have the same 2nd foreign language. The group will deliver a project report in English. The report is read by the course supervisors and another project group. This other project group has the task of providing critical / elaborate / clarifying questions to the project report at the exam with the course supervisors. (Each group has two tasks - writing a report yourself - and reading / asking questions for another group's report). See also below Test form and remarks.
danishContents: De studerende arbejder sammen i grupper, som er sat sammen så alle studerende i gruppen har samme 2. fremmedsprog. Gruppen afleverer en projekt-rapport på engelsk. Rapporten læses af kursus-vejlederne og en anden projekt-gruppe. Denne anden projekt-gruppe har som opgave sammen med kursus-vejlederne at stille kritiske/uddybende/opklarende spørgsmål til projekt-rapporten ved eksamen. (Hver gruppe har altså to opgaver - at skrive en rapport selv - og at læse/stille spørgsmål til en anden gruppes rapport). Se i øvrigt også under Prøveform og Bemærkninger.
englishTitle: International Marketing and Internet based IT-Systems

englishContents: The students will learn structured and object oriented programming by programming LEGO Mindstorms robots as well as PCs.  The students will work with:- installation of software- crossplatform development- different operating systems such as Windows and Linux- the organization and programs use of RAMDuring programming students will learn to use:- controll structures, conditions, and loops- classes and objects- user defined classes- variables and datatypes- text strings- arrays and lists- methods, parameters, and return values- console input/output- read and write text files- the structure of object orientated programs- programs with several source files- an IDE for program developmentBy developing their own robots and programs students learn:- to analyze, design, and implement software systems- to use common UML diagrams- to describe IT systems in words and writingBy building the LEGO robots students learn about:- what robots can be used for- motors that enables robots to move- different sensors providing robots with input- quality of sensors and handling of sensor data- communication between PC and robot- external factors that might influence robot operation- autonomes robots
danishContents: De studerende lærer struktureret og objektorienteret programmering ved at programmere både LEGO Mindstorm robotter og almindelige PC systemer. Herunder arbejder de studerende med:- installation af software- crossplatform development- forskellige operativsystemer som Windows og Linux- organisering og programmers brug af RAMUnder programmering lærer de studerende at anvende:- kontrolstrukturer, betingelser og løkker- klasser og objekter- brugerdefinerede klasser- variable og deres datatyper- tekst strenge- arrays og lister- metoder, parametre og returværdi- input/output til konsol- læse og skrive tekst filer- struktur af objektorienterede programmer- programmer bestående af flere kildetekster- en IDE til programudviklingVed at udvikle egne robotter og programmer lærer de studerende om:- analyse, design og implementering af software systemer- de mest almindelige UML diagrammer- at beskrive IT systemer i tale og på skriftVed at bygge LEGO robotter lærer de studerende om:- hvad man kan bruge robotter til- motorer, der får robotter til at bevæge sig- forskellige sensorer, der giver input til robotter- kvalitet af sensorer og behandling af sensordata- kommunikation mellem PC og robot- ydre faktorer, der påvirker robotters funktion- autonome robotter

englishContents: Computer Networking: The internet protocol stack and the most commonly used protocols in the internet protocol stack. Wired as well as wireless communication standards. Introduction to the term cloud computing.International marketing: Teaching in the use of macro meso and micro tools in connection with international market analysis. Evaluation of the company's international competitiveness using Michael Porter's theories. Selection of distribution channel and management in relation to the desire for control over financial capacity. Possible use of protection policies for the company based on the use of patents. Developments in e-business and m-commerce and consideration of the company's business use. Furthermore, increasing focus on the individual customer, including the use of customer relationship management and social media.International economy: The national economy is rich in conflicts about what resources need to be used and how to control it; But the whole worth is in the sign of change. EMU and euro have been incorporated and have been central to the debate; But globalization is not only a key to wealth but also to conflict. Each country's fiscal and monetary policy must be aligned with both fixed and floating rates and the EU's approach to a merged entity calls for all kinds of assessments. By using the sharp cutting tools of economic theory, conflicts can be made clear and much of the uncertainty removed. Economic theory can give students a relevant understanding of the basis for decision making.Methodological considerations for use in project work.
danishTitle: International Markedsføring, International Økonomi, Computer Netværk
danishContents: Netværksteori / IT:  Internettets almindeligt anvendte applikationsprotokoller. Internettets TCP/IP protokoller. Beskrivelse af virkemåden af såvel kablede som trådløse kommunikationsstandarder. Fokus lægges på begreber som protokoller og interfacing og en samlet forståelse af internettets protokolstak. Desuden gives et godt overblik over specielt de mest anvendte mobile kommunikationsstander. Introduktion til begrebet Cloud Computing.International markedsføring: Undervisning i brug af makro- og mikroværktøjer i forbindelse med international markedsanalyse. Vurdering af virksomhedens internationale konkurrenceevne ved hjælp af Michael Porters teorier. Valg af distributionskanal og styring i forhold til ønske om kontrol overfor økonomisk formåen. Mulige anvendelser af beskyttelsespolitikker for virksomheden med udgangspunkt i brug af patenter.Udviklingen indenfor e-business og m-commerce og overvejelser omkring virksomhedens forretningsmæssige brug heraf. Endvidere forårsager et stigende fokus på den enkelte kunde, et relationsmarkedsføring fokus, herunder brug af customer relationship management og sociale medier.International økonomi: Den nationale økonomi er rig på konflikter om, hvad ressourcerne skal bruges til, og hvordan der skal styres; men hele verdnen er i forandringens tegn. ØMU og euro er blevet indarbejdet og har fået en central placering i debatten; men globalisering er ikke kun en nøgle til velstand, men også til konflikt. Det enkelte lands finans- og pengepolitik skal afstemmes med hensyn til såvel faste som flydende kurser og EU's vej mod en sammensvejset enhed påkalder sig alle slags vurderinger. Ved at anvende den økonomiske teoris skarpt skærende redskaber kan konflikterne gøres overskuelige og meget af usikkerheden fjernes. Den økonomiske teori kan give de studerende en relevant forståelse for det beslutningsgrundlag, de politiske valg træffes på.Metodeovervejelser til brug i projektarbejde.
englishTitle: International Marketing, International Economics and Computer Networking
